Inicio su actividad con dinero propio que tenia ahorrado ya que sus hijos le enviaban remesas del extranjero entonces decidió poner su propio negocio, anteriormente  se dedicaba a la venta de ropa pero se retiro porque no le generaba muchas ganancias, cuenta con otros ingresos provenientes de sus hijos que le mandan remesas.
Realizo el préstamo para comprar pollo, arroz, aceite, plátano, carne, etc, todo lo insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus platillos. Ella estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que podrá invertir  más en su negocio, sus planes futuros es cancelar el crédito con las ganancias que le genere el negocio y seguir contando con el apoyo de otros créditos para crecer  en su negocio con el propósito de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, su metas próximas es hacerle mejoras a su humilde vivienda para tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ligia, 59, is originally from Estelí. She studied nursing, she is the mother of 4 children of the ages of majority who live independently. As well as having her nursing studies, she’s been selling food for 3 years. She started her business with money that she saved when her children sent her installments from abroad. She withdrew from her previous job selling clothing to start her own food business, because she wasn’t generating much income.

She is requesting a loan to buy chicken, rice, oil, bananas, meat, etc. -- all of the ingredients necessary to make her dishes. She thinks the credit will help her as she’ll be able to invest more in her business. Her future plans are to cancel the credit with the earnings her business generates and continue counting on the support of other loans to grow her business in order to satisfy her clientele. Her next goals are to make renovations to her home in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy chicken, rice, oil, bananas and meat.

loans.name: Yudis Ismenia

texts.es:
Yudis, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para el negocio, comprándose maíz, quesillo, gas, aceite, y otros que son necesarios para mejorar el negocio, espera a través de este aporte seguir proveyendo lo necesario a su familia.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, pues le dio más fuerza al negocio y a logrado mantenerse brindando un buen servicio, las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Yudis is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business, purchasing corn, cheese, cooking gas, cooking oil, and other items that are necessary to improve business. She hopes through this effort to continue providing necessities for her family.

The effect of her previous loan was positive, since it gave her business more strength and she has been able to maintain it, offering good customer service. The circumstances of her family have improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, cooking gas, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo  para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, comprándose una variedad de prendas de vestir en blusas, faldas, ropa interior, esto le ayudara a mejorar la disponibilidad de mercadería para seguir mejorando las ventas.
El préstamo anterior le permitió crecer y tener la mercadería necesaria para poder seguir trabajando, sus circunstancias familiares han mejorado, ofreciéndole una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is asking for a new loan to continue investing in her business by buying a variety of articles of clothing such as blouses, skirts, and underclothes. This will help her to improve the availability of merchandise to continue improving her sales.

The previous loan allowed her to grow and have the necessary merchandise to be able to keep working. Her family circumstances have improved, offering a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, and underclothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire « Njiwa », est entrepreneur ambitieux, qui levé sa main,  mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse des souliers. Son mari est  aussi petit commerçant de divers. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal de  CADECO- dans le centre Ville. Il y a 8 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette petite activité génératrice de revenus. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  19 cycles de crédit dans le programme de ‘IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  15 pairs de souliers à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  acheter une parcelle personnelle qu’elle offrira  comme cadeau à ses parents biologiques.  La cliente salut l’initiative de l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The client, hand raised in the photo, is the leader of the "Njiwa" business group. She is an ambitious entrepreneur, and is married with seven children, all of whom are in school. She sells shoes. Her husband is also a small-scale retailer of miscellaneous items. She sells her products at the CADECO communal market in the town center. She has been involved in this income-producing activity for eight years. However, she has recently completed 19 loan cycles with the Hekima IMF program. This new loan will allow her to buy 15 pairs of shoes for re-sale.  Also, she plans to educate her children and buy a small piece of land that she will offer as a gift to her biological parents.  She is grateful to Hekima IMF for helping poor women who are excluded from traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sokkea

texts.en:
Sokkea (in the photo) is 46 years old and her husband, Sruoy is 44 years old, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1989 and have four children-three sons and one daughter. One is a garment worker, another one attends primary school, another one attends high school and another one is in university. 

Sokkea is a garment worker, while her husband is a farmer. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her son who is in university to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan (pictured here) is 50 years old and her husband, Chev is 55 years old, have been married since 1980 and they have five sons and two daughters. One is married and lives separately, two are garment workers, three attend school and another has full-time employment. The family lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yan and her husband are rice farmers. She also operates tailoring business by putting together fabric swatches for clothing manufacturer. Yan is asking for a loan of $1,300 to assist in her rice farming business by buying motorized hand tiller.

loans.use: to buy a motorized hand tiller for use in her rice farming business.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo, es casado y tiene una hija con el cual vive en casa propia y tienen tres habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como consultor en el área de la educación por más de ocho horas al día, en una empresa privada ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y servicios básicos de su familia
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de inscripciones y compra de material escolar para su hijo ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para el pago de los estudios de su hija.
El sueño de Rodrigo, es mejorar sus ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos de los estudios de su hija.
Es la primera vez que el cliente solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is married, and he lives with his daughter in his own house.  They have three rooms, and the house is located in the Villa San Antonio area of the city of La Paz.

He currently gets income working as an educational consultant for over eight ours a day.  He works for a private company because he needs to cover the food expenses and the family’s basic services expenses.

He needs the loan to pay enrollment fees and to buy school materials.  He does not earn enough to pay for his daughter’s education.

This is the first time he has requested a loan together with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay enrollment fees and to buy school materials for his daughter.

loans.name: Anny Jennifer

texts.es:
Anny es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy caluroso en cualquier época del año, se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, paprika, uva, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Anny le gusta mucho comer una de sus comidas favoritas el cual es la Pizza. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Anny trabaja en su negocio de venta de pan, aceituna y palta, trabaja desde muy temprano y se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas al día, puede atender hasta 25 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo vende productos de calidad.

Anny está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar un carrito para poder ofrecer sus productos de manera más ordenada y limpia ya que con el que cuenta actualmente está muy viejito, con esta mejora ella podrá vender sus productos de mejor manera, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y poder dar una mejor atención a sus clientes, así ella seguirá trabajando día a día y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble ya que actualmente es de esteras”.
texts.en:
Anny is a hard-working woman and she lives in the city of Ica, a city that is characterized by its warm climate in all seasons of the year.  In this region they grow cotton, asparagus, pepper, grapes, and other things.  When Anny has free time she likes to eat pizza, one of her favorite foods.  She only completed high school but would have liked to have had a university education.

Day by day Anny works at her business of selling bread, olives and avocado.  She works 8 hours per day and begins very early in the morning.  She can service 25 clients every day.  She believes that her business is going well because she is very friendly, and above all, her products are high-quality.

Anny is very thankful for Kiva loans and says that thanks to the help they have provided her, she will be able to buy a new cart so that she can better organize the products she sells and the cart will be cleaner (her current cart is very old.)  With this improvement, she will be able to sell her products better and she will be able to increase her income.  She will also be able to give her clients more attention.  She will continue working every day and struggling to realize her biggest dream: to build a house with good materials because now her house is made with mats.

loans.use: to buy a new cart so that she can sell bread.

loans.name: Koemhorng

texts.en:
Koemhorng (in the photo) is 31 years old and her husband, Chheng Kim, is 33 years old. They have been married since 2000 and they just have one young daughter. The family lives in a village about 28 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Koemhorng and her husband are rice farmers and raise pigs at home when they are not on the farm. Koemhorng is in the process of building her own house to live in, but the house is not finished yet. That's why she is asking for a loan of $500. Previously, Koemhorng did not have her own house, so she needed to stay with her parents.

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Zahi

texts.en:
Zahi, 38, is Lebanese and married to Zeinab, a lovely wife and the mother of his five children. She’s a great support to him, and even though they both work, they struggle to cover the usual family expenses without forgetting their children’s study fees.

For the past five years, Zeinab has been cultivating pomegranates on a plot of land, while for many years Zahi has owned a farm where he raises cattle for dairy products. A very good manager, he has also worked at a chicken farm for ten years.

Because he wants to develop his business, Zahi is requesting a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional cattle for his farm. In his opinion, this step will allow him to increase his productivity, thus leading to increased earnings and an improved standard of living. He also hopes to open a small shop where he can sell his dairy products, which are of very high quality..

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle for his farm.

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr: Karim est un commerçant ambulant âgé de 36 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. il vend du thé dans les rues de la capitale Camerounaise depuis deux ans et dispose d'une clientèle fidèle. Il se sert de deux thermos pour la conservation de son thé et voudrait ainsi avec ce crédit en acheter quatre supplémentaires en plus du sucre, thé (en matière première)qu'il voudrait mettre en stock pour constituer une réserve afin de palier au problème de rupture. Il envisage épargner les revenus supplémentaires générés afin d'ouvrir à terme une boutique et se marier dans un futur proche.
texts.en: Karim is 36 years old, single with no children. He has been selling tea on foot in the streets of the capital of Cameroon for two years, and he has many loyal customers. Karim uses two thermoses to carry the tea, and with this loan he would like to buy four more as well as sugar, and tea (as a raw material) that he would like to keep in reserve in case his inventory runs low. With the extra income, he plans to eventually open a store, and get married in the near future.

loans.use: to buy equipment for selling tea.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, esta divorciada y tiene dos hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Miraflores d la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja por más de ocho horas en una empresa pública de la ciudad de La Paz., ya que es el único ingreso que tiene para pagar la alimentación, educación y servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar un Diplomado de Derecho y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a sus hijos.
El sueño de Cecilia, es mejorar sus ingresos y comprarse una casa para dar más comodidad y seguridad a sus hijos.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Cecilia is divorced and has two children.  She lives in her parents’ house, occupying two rooms with brick walls.  The house is located in the Miraflores area of the city of La Paz.

She currently gets income because she works for over eight hours in a public company in the city of La Paz.  This is the only income that she has to pay for food, education, and basic services for her family.

She needs the loan to pay for a diploma in legal studies.  This way she will improve her income in order to support her children.

Cecilia’s dream is to improve her income and to buy a house.  She will do this to make her children more comfortable and safer.

This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a diploma in legal studies to improve her income and make her family more comfortable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy six sacks of fertilizer and a bag of corn seed to grow and harvest corn.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de una nueva bicicleta y lo demás en la compra de pan para salir a revender, él considera que a través de estos prestamos esta creciendo y mejorando su situación en la venta de pan, ya que al obtener la bicicleta se trasladara mejor hacia la zona que atiende.
Con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar la bicicleta anterior, pero ahora se ha decidido ha tener una nueva, en su negocio pues ha mantenido la clientela a quienes distribuye todos los dias
texts.en:
Juan is requesting another loan so that he can buy a new bicycle, and he will use the rest to buy bread to sell.  He thinks that through these loans, his business is growing and his economic situation is improving.  Once he get this bicycle, he will be able to move around better in the area where he sells.

With his previous loan he was able to do some work on his bicycle, but now he has decided to get a new one.  In his business, he has maintained a customer base to whom he distributes his bread each day.

loans.use: to buy a new bicycle

loans.name: Adriana Auxiliadora

texts.es: Adriana , originaria de Granada de oficio comerciante nos comparte su punto de vista sobre su experiencia con el anterior credito Kiva el cual utilizo para comprar ingredientes para realizar sus platillos , la capacidad de adquirir y ofrecer variedad es lo que permitio que sus ingresos mejoraran , el prestamo le abrio las puertas para que su negocio experimentara crecimiento y pudiera adquirir nuevos clientes estas muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida. Su demanda ha crecido , requiere mas materia prima para trabajar, por eso esta solicitando este credito para  invertir en compra de  carne, pollo, aceite, arroz, plátano verde y bebidas todos los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar su comida. Siempre tiene en su meta lograr tener su propio kiosco de comida.
texts.en: Adriana, a native of Granada, works as a merchant.  She shares her point of view regarding her experience with her previous Kiva loan, which she used to buy ingredients to make her dishes.  The ability to acquire and offer a greater variety of products is what allowed her to increase her income.  The loan opened the doors so that her business could experience growth, and she was able to acquire new customers.  She is very grateful for the help provided.  Her demand has grown, and she needs more raw materials for her work.  For this reason, she is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of meat, chicken, cooking oil, rice, green bananas and drinks, all of the ingredients she needs to make her food.  Her goal has always been to have her own kiosk to sell food.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, cooking oil, rice, green bananas and drinks

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi has three children.  She lives in Kwale, Kenya.  She generates her own income by selling food products and palm leaves for roof thatching.

She started her business approximately six months ago.  As a mother and head of the household, her biggest challenge is to provide for and meet the needs of her children until she achieves her dream of seeing them become successful people.  They are the impetus for her to continually work. 

Her joy and dynamism help her succeed in her business, but she needs to increase her business capital to achieve her goal of generating more income.  This is why she is requesting her first Kiva loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust, with which she will buy varied merchandise like food products and palm leaves for resale.  She needs disposable income to stock up and offer her clients more products.  This will result in the success of her investment and will be the advancement she needs to be able to achieve her dreams in the future.

loans.use: buy more food products and palm leaves to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 45-year-old businessman who is married to Susan, also a business lady. They are blessed with four children aged 24, 21, 19 and 15 years old. He has been a tailor for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Bernard will use the loan to purchase more stock of clothing materials for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

In future he hopes to open a boutique.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials for his business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 22-year-old single lady. She has been selling charcoal for a period of about two years with an income of about 5,000 Kes a month. 

This is her first loan with KADET and she wants to use it to buy more stock of charcoal for resale. She hopes to be financially stable and better her life.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Manuel Rafael

texts.es:
Manuel, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en el negocio, pues está en la época de iniciar los preparativos en la tierra, comprándose insumos para prevenir y fortalecer la plantación como el abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, ya que comúnmente el cultivo se debe prevenir de los posibles riesgos. 
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que trabajo su parcela de tierra y produjo buena cosecha, la cual ha sido utilizada para la venta y para la alimentación de de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is asking for a new loan to invest it on his business. 
This is the time to start preparing the land, to buy the materials to prevent [damages] and strengthen the land like fertilizer, weed-killer and insect-killer because commonly one should prevent possible damages with the crops.

The effect the previous loan was positive because he worked his plot of land and produced good crops which he used to sell and feed his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed-killer, insect killer

loans.name: Aleyda Maryinee

texts.es:
Aleyda continua vendiendo su ropa de segunda,  asi como la venta de sandalias, carteras, cosmeticos, que gracias a los financiamiento obtenidos ha venido invirtiendo en variedad de productos, su esposo trabaja en taxi siendo de su propiedad, apoyando  a sus hijos los cuales los tres estudian.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo comprara: dos pacas y cosmeticos, siendo lo mas vendido y adqueridos por los clientes por ser de precios accesibles y de buena calidad. sus ventas son al contado y al credito, dando la oportunidad al cliente de adquirir su mercaderia, logrando con esto, la captacion de mas clientes.
texts.en: Aleyda is continuing with her business selling used clothing, as well as sandals, handbags, and cosmetics.  Thanks to the loans she has taken, she has been investing in a variety of products.  Her husband works as a taxi driver using his own vehicle, and they are supporting their three children who are in school.  Now with this new loan, she will buy: two bales of used clothing and some cosmetics, being that these sell the most because her customers can acquire good quality products at very affordable prices.  She makes her sales on a cash basis and on credit, giving her customers the opportunity to acquire her merchandise, and in this way attracting more customers.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Mediko

texts.en:
Mediko, 62, lives in a small village in the Sagarejo District with her husband Tsismari, their 42-year-old son, and two grandchildren. Her son works for a state agency, while the elder grandchild is unemployed and the younger one studies in the local school.

Mediko and her husband earn their living in agriculture. They have five milking cows, and Mediko produces cheese which she sells on the local open market. The family also has a vineyard on a one-hectare plot of land, selling the grapes locally. Additionally, Mediko’s husband makes wine in the fall, selling it in nearby villages. Their total average monthly income is 1000 Lari.

Mediko is requesting a loan to purchase medicines against parasites to protect the grape harvest. This will increase both the yield and her profits. With the help of this Kiva loan the family's income will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the costs incurred in maintaining her vineyard.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 36-year-old business lady.  She is married to Jeremiah, who is a business man, and they are blessed with two children.  She has been keeping poultry for the past three years and making a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced to it by a KADET staff member.  Josephine will use the loan to buy chicks and feed for her poultry business.  She will educate her children with the anticipated business profits.  She hopes to export the eggs wholesale soon.

loans.use: buy chicks and feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 66-year-old business lady and a single mother of four children; three are adults and one is 16 years old.  She has been running a medical clinic for the past 15 years and making a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced to it by a KADET staff member.  Helen will use the loan to purchase a piece of land which she will use in the future.  She hopes to build rental houses and improve the living standards of her family.  She will use the anticipated profits from the clinic business to educate her children.

loans.use: purchase a piece of land.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
Richard,  es casado y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en una casa en alquiler ocupando solo un habitación con paredes de tierra y el piso de cemento, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudió solo hasta la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como chofer por más de diez horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche, también cuenta con los ingresos de su esposa ya que tiene una tienda de tostados (productos como el maní, habas, arroz, porotos, etc., son tostados al calor y con azúcar, de tal forma que el producto final tiene un sabor especial) , es por eso que ambos corren con los  gastos de alimentación, estudios y gastos médicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital en la tienda de tostados, comprar más materia prima, producir más y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Richard, es tener su casa propia y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia brindándoles más comodidad.
Es la cuarta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Richard is married and has two children.  They live in a rented house, and they occupy only one room.  It has cement walls and a dirt floor.  The house is located in the Rió Seco area in the city of El Alto.

He only has a high school education.  He currently works as a driver for over ten hours a day until the late hours of the night.  He also has another income from his wife.  She has a “tostados” store (products like peanuts, beans, rice and “porotes” or bread toasted with sugar in such a way that it has a good flavor, etc.).   This is why both of them contribute to the food, educational, and medical expenses of the family.

He needs the loan to increase his capital in the toastados store.  He will buy more ingredients to make more.  This will improve their income to support their family.

Richard’s dream is to have his own house and to improve his family’s quality of life by making them more comfortable.

This is the fourth time he has worked with IMPRO and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, rice, beans, and "porotos" for his wife's business of making and selling tostados to the public.

loans.name: Maria Ramona

texts.es: Doña Maria  de 38 años de edad, originara de Granada, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de calzado desde hace 3 años, casada, madre de 4 hijos los cuales están a su cargo. Ella inicia su segundo préstamo kiva, el primero le ayudo de gran manera ya que le permitió invertir en su inventario ofreciendo más variedades de productos lo que incremento a la vez  sus ventas. Su primer crédito lo utilizo para comprar mercadería como zapatos, chinela, bolso y sandalias. Ahora solicita su segundo préstamo al igual para invertir en mercadería pero esta vez para comprar productos alusivos al mes de las madres tales como sandalias, bolsos, blusas y zapatos de dama para complacer a todas las madres que pasan por su negocio a comprar de los estilos de productos que les ofrece Maria, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposo. Este segundo préstamo le permitirá mejorar sus ventas con nueva variedad de productos y a la vez incrementaran sus ganancias ya que su meta próxima es mantener su trabajo para salir adelante con su familia y no depender de créditos.
texts.en: Maria, 38, is a native of Granada.  She has been selling shoes for 3 years.  She is married, and is the mother of 4 children who are in her care.  She is initiating her second loan with Kiva.  Her first loan helped her a lot, because it allowed her to invest in more inventory so that she could offer a greater variety of products and increase her sales.  With her first loan, she bought merchandise such as shoes, slippers, purses and sandals.  Now she is requesting her second loan, which she will also use to purchase merchandise.  However, this time she will buy items targeting the month of mother's day, such as: sandals, purses, blouses and women's shoes.  This way Maria will please all of the mothers who pass through her business to buy from the styles and products that she offers them.  In her business, Maria receives the support of her husband.  This second loan will allow her to improve her sales with new and varied products, and so will increase her earnings.  Her next goal is to maintain her business so that she can get ahead with her family and not have to rely on loans.

loans.use: to buy sandals, purses, blouses and women's shoes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with three children, and two of her children go to school.  She takes care of one additional family member, her sister.  

She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis.  She earns additional income from selling charcoal and works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last two years.  She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal.  

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality.  She hopes to accumulate more profits and buy a plot of land to build her own house and become a wholesaler.  She lives in a rented house, and her family has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and charcoal to re-sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de su tía ocupando solo una habitación  de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
José trabaja como conductor asalariado de lunes a viernes por más de ocho horas, también obtiene ingresos ya que los fines de semana trabaja como arbitro en diferentes canchas de fútbol, y con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y servicios básicos, es por eso que solicita el crédito por que no le alcanza para pagar sus estudios y con el crédito que solicita desea pagar cursos superiores  de informática.
El sueño que tiene José, es tener su vehiculo propio ya que actualmente trabaja  hasta altas horas de la noche corriendo muchos peligros, también desea terminar sus estudios y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
José is single, and he has no children.  He lives in his aunt’s house, and he occupies only one brick room with a dirt floor.  The house is located in the Rió Seco area of the city of El Alto.

José works as a salaried drives from Mondays to Fridays for over eight hours.  He gets other income because he works the week-ends as a referee at different soccer fields.  With the little he earns he needs to cover the food expenses and basic services.

That is why his is requesting the loan.  He does not have enough to pay for his studies.  He wishes to use the loan to pay for upper level courses in computer science.

José’s dream is to have his own vehicle.  He currently works into the late hours of the night, and it is very dangerous.  He also wishes to finish his studies in order to improve his income and his quality of life.

This is the first time he has worked together with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for upper level courses in computer science in order to improve his income and his quality of life.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Maria, continua dia a dia con su venta de café, pan, tibio de leche, gaseosa, chicha, vendiendo ambulante, para ella el objetivo es terminar de cerrar su casa, el cual va trabajando por ciclo, ya que sus ingresos los tiene que distribuir con los gastos del hogar,con el credito anterior,logro cerrar una parte del techo, lo que seguira haciendo en toda la casa, 
Comprando laminas de zinc,  cuartones, clavos, para seguir la obra, y poder terminar de poner el techo.
texts.en: Maria continues each day with her business selling coffee, bread, warm milk, soft drinks, and chicha (a traditional Nicaraguan beverage made with corn).  She sells from place to place. Her goal is to finish building her house, which she has been working on each loan cycle, because she has to allocate her income to the household expenses.  With her previous loan, she managed to put in part of the roof, and she wants to extend the roof over the whole house.  She will use the loan to buy sheets of laminated metal roofing material, rafters, and nails to continue the work so that she can finish putting in the roof.

loans.use: to buy sheets of laminated metal roofing material, rafters, and nails to put in a roof

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is still running her retail shop and was able to pay back her previous loan without any difficulties.

She has applied for another loan from KADET, which she plans to use to purchase more stock, including cereals, breads, sugars and cooking oils, which are currently running low in her shop.

She is a single mother of four children, and is working hard to ensure that she meets all of her family's needs.  She is also working towards becoming financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán, es soltero y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa Abaroa de la ciudad de La Paz.
Hernán, trabaja por más de ocho horas realizando contratos ya que es Arquitecto y es por eso que solicita el crédito ya que debe terminar una obra de construcción de aulas en una escuela ya que le pagan una vez terminada la obra y necesita comprar material de construcción como ser cemento, arena, ladrillo etc.
El sueño de Hernán, es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que el cliente solícita un crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Hernán is single and does not have children.  He is currently living in only one room of his parents’ house.  The house is located in the Villa Abaroa area of the city of La Paz.

Hernán is an architect, and he spends over eight hours a day working on contracts.  That is why he is requesting the loan.  He needs to finish a construction job of classrooms in a school.  They pay him once the work is finished, and he needs to buy construction materials like cement, sand, and bricks, etc.

Hernán’s dream is to improve his income and to be able to become independent in order to improve his quality of life.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materiasl like cement, sand, and bricks, etc. in order to continue building classrooms in a school where he has a construction contract.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida tiene 23 años de edad, es muy trabajadora y sobre todo tiene mucho optimista y ganas de superación, es madre de un pequeño a quien saca adelante y por quien daría la vida con tal de verlos feliz y sobre todo que sea mucho mejor que ella. Vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, así como también se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de esparrago, uva, algodón, paprika, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y en ocasiones le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima Carapulcra con sopa seca. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el cuarto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Con mucho entusiasmo Zenaida trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 23 clientes en el dia; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo vende productos de calidad a un precio cómodo.

Zenaida está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracia a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un andamio para poder exhibir sus productos así como también comparar mas mercadería como golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, fideos, conservas, entre otros, así ella podrá tener mayor variedad de productos y poder atender de mejor manera a los clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para a hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 23 years old, hardworking and above all, is optimistic with a desire to succeed.  She is the mother of a small child whom she wants to support. She would give her life to see her child happy and have a better than she has.  She lives in the city of Ica, a city that is characterized by its warm climate, as well as agriculture developments, especially the cultivation of asparagus, grapes, cotton and paprika amongst others. When she has spare time, she enjoys listening to music and sometimes likes to eat one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Carapulcra” [meat stew] with dry soup.  Due to the limited economic resources of her parents, she could only study up to the fourth grade of secondary school, but she would have liked to study nursing.

Zenaida works enthusiastically at her grocery selling business. She works about 8 hours a day and can serve up to 23 clients in the day. She believes that she is doing well at her business because she is kind to her customers and above all sells quality products at an affordable price.

Zenaida is very grateful for Kiva lenders. It is thanks to their help she has been able to buy shelving to display her products as well as test new merchandise such as candy, soft drinks, noodles and preserves amongst others. Having more variety of products helps her to better serve her customers, which will increase her earnings and help in the everyday fight to realize her big dream, to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy shelving and merchandise (candy, soft drinks, noodles, canned, etc.).

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 58-year-old business man.  He is married to Alice, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with four children, ages 21, 17, 11 and 7.  He has been running a retail shop for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his third loan with KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully.  He will use this loan to purchase more stock for his shop, including sugar, rice and wheat flour.  With the anticipated profits from his business, he will educate his children. 

In the future, he hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his retail shop.

loans.name: Verónica Paola

texts.es:
Verónica es una mujer de 30 años y casada con Pablo de 33 años con quien tiene dos hijos. Viven en "Chillogallo" una parroquia de Quito, la capital del Ecuador. Es muy pintoresca y es caracterizada por su actividad comercial. La mayoría de comerciantes son de pequeños a medianos y un gran número de informales. Se ubica al extremo sur de la ciudad.

Mientras Pablo trabaja como guardia en una empresa privada desde hace 14 años, Verónica trabaja preparando comida rápida y dulces desde hace 2 años, esto lo aprendió de una amiga la cual actualmente se dedica a esta actividad. Sus principales clientes son estudiantes escolares y colegiales ya que su comida tiene precios módicos para este segmento. La actividad más difícil es la preparación de la "espumilla", un dulce típico producto de batir huevos durante aproximadamente una hora y media hasta obtener una crema fina y luego mezclarla con pulpa de alguna fruta y azúcar, ya que tiene que prepararla a las 4 a.m. para de esta manera venderla en la puerta de ingreso de una escuelita. Trabaja un promedio de 10 horas al día y sus hijas le ayudan en su labor. Pagar el arriendo de su local es un costo que para ella es alto, sin embargo ha sabido ser una persona cumplida y responsable. Verónica desea invertir en dulces para su tienda y en insumos para la elaboración de comida rápida; para ello necesita un crédito con el cual pueda crecer y sobre todo dar a sus hijos y esposo la posibilidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Para Verónica la familia es sumamente importante y durante su tiempo libre le gusta pasear con ellos en parques y centros comerciales. Su sueño es crecer económicamente y dar a su familia todo lo necesario para llevar una vida libre de carencias.
texts.en:
Verónica is a 30 year old woman, married to Pablo 33 and they have two children.  

They live in "Chillogallo" a parish in the city of Quito, the capital of Ecuador; It's very quaint and it's known for its commercial activities. Most of its business are small or medium-sized and a big group of informal businesses. "Chillogallo" is located in the southern end of the city.

Whilst Pablo works as a security guard in a private company in which he has been for the last 14 years, Verónica works making fast food and sweets and has done so for the las 2 years. She learned this from a friend who is also in the same business. 
Her main customers are students because her food has affordable prices for them. The hardest part in her job is the preparation of the "Espumilla"  a typical sweet made by whisking eggs for about an hour and a half untill it becomes a fine cream that then is mixed with some fruit pulp and sugar. It is hard because she has to prepare it at 4:00 am so she can sell it outside the entrance of a little school.
she works an average of 10 hours a day and her daughters help her with the work.
To pay for her shop's rent is a cost that for her is high, but she has been a reliable and responsible person.
Verónica wants to invest in sweets for her shop and supplies for making fast food, for that she needs a loan that can help her grow and above all give her children and husband the possibility of a better quality of life.

For veronica, her family is extremely important and on her free time she likes going out with them to parks and malls. Her dream is to grow economically and give her family everything they need so they can have a life free of deprivations.

loans.use: To buy sweets and supplies to make fast food, also, to use as capital for her shop.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María de los Angeles es una señora de 62 años, que habira al Sur de la capital de San José de Costa Rica, especificamente en la provincia de San José, en el cantón Central, en el distrito de Hatillo; desde hace varios años atras, se dedica a dos actividades productivas, la confección de prendas de vestir, y la venta de cosméticos ofreciendolo a sus clientes mediante el sistema de crédito; pero esta señora no se queda allí, ya que dentro de sus planes a futuro tiene la compra de una máquina de bordar, para poder ponerle las iniciales a las almohadas ortopedicas que le encargan, asi como a otras prendas para el hogar que confecciona.
Las prendas y la actividad del comercio la desarrolla en la provincia de Puntarenas, ya que ella va dos veces por mes a visitar a su madre que ya es una persona mayor, pero pador costear los boletos de autobus aprovecha y vende sus productos y en el viaje siguiente cobra y vuelve a vender sus mercancias.
texts.en:
María de los Angeles, 62, lives south of San José, the capital city of Costa Rica, in the province of San José, in the central canton of the district of Hatillo. For many years she’s taken part in productive activities, like dressmaking and selling cosmetics to her clients on credit. But this lady doesn’t just stop there, she has future plans to buy a sewing machine, so that she can sew initials into the orthopedic pillows her clients order from her, as well as other items for the household that she makes.
She develops her business in the province of Puntarenas, where she goes twice a month to visit her mother who is an elderly person. To afford the bus, she sells her products and on the next trip back, she collects and sells more of her items.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Otilio

texts.es:
El joven Otilio es un trabajador comerciante, está casado, tiene una hija de 5 años, el vive en la ciudad de Pilar , es una persona muy activa, responsable y trabajadora y muy querido en el barrio.
El se dedica a las ventas hace ya unos ya que tiene una despensa muy bien surtida gracias a la cual puede mantener y ayudar a su familia. Comenta que su deseo es poder tener un gran comercio y de esa forma aumentar sus ganancias y seguir ayudando a sus familias.
Otilio solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para poder abastecer su negocio con todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, como ser leche, panificados, azúcar, bebidas, y demás insumos. El está muy agradecido por la ayuda que está recibiendo, ya que esto le ayudará a seguir creciendo más y más día a día.
texts.en:
Otilio is a young man working as a store merchant. He is married with a 5 year old daughter.  He lives in the city of Pilar.  He is a very active, responsible, hardworking and well-liked person in the neighborhood. 

He has worked in sales a few years now and because he keeps a well-stocked inventory, he can support and maintain his family. He says his desire is to have a great business and thus increase profits and continue to help his family. 

Otilio requesting a loan for the purchase of materials in order to supply his business with all kinds of staple products, such as milk, bread, sugar and beverages amongst others. He is very grateful for the assistance that he is receiving, as it will help him to grow his business more every day.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, baked goods sugar, beverages and other staple groceries.

loans.name: Los Amigos De La Montaña Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Los Amigos de la Montaña, los integrantes decidieron nombrarlo así porque todos se conocen desde hace varios años y han desarrollado una buena amistad. Todos ellos viven en la comunidad de Tilapa la cual está en lo alto de la montaña, el clima es frío todo el año ya que se encuentra en la zona alta, su vegetación es de amplios bosques de pinos y la gente se dedica a la siembra de café y plátano. 

La señora Minerva cuenta con 44 años de edad y está casada; tiene 5 hijos que continúan estudiando. Minerva tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes desde hace 3 años. Comenta que inició con esta actividad porque en su comunidad solo hay 2 tiendas parecidas, pero no están muy surtidas. Minerva tenía la intención de ofrecer un surtido más amplio, vender lo más indispensable y lo que se ocupa del diario en las casas. El préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mercancía como: azúcar, sal, arroz, frijol, focos, aceite, leche, refrescos, pasta dental, pastas para sopa, refrescos, agua, jabón, etc. 

La meta de Doña Minerva es la de ampliar el negocio, comprar una vitrina y anaqueles para surtir con más productos. También tiene pensado ahorrar para comprar una computadora a sus hijos.

"Muchas gracias a Visión Fund y a los prestatarios de Kiva por confiar en mí y apoyarme para continuar invirtiendo en mi pequeña tienda".

Los integrantes de este grupo y las actividades a las que se dedican cada uno de ellos son: 

María: deposito de refrescos.
Francisca: venta de abarrotes.
Minerva: venta de abarrotes.
Benjamín: venta de abarrotes. 
Francisco: florería.
Maximina: venta de comida.
Rosa: pollería.
texts.en:
This group is called Los Amigos de la Montaña (Friends from the Mountain). The members decided to name it this because all of them have known each other for several years and have developed a good friendship. All of them live in the community of Tilapa which is at the top of the mountain. The weather is cold all year as it is found in the upper zone. The vegetation includes expansive pine forests and the people grow coffee and bananas.

Minerva is 44 years old and married. She has 5 children who are students. Minerva has had a little grocery store for 3 years. She says that she opened her store because in her community there are only 2 similar stores, but they are not diverse. Minerva had the idea of offering a broader choice, to sell the most vital things and what is used daily in the home. The loan is going to be used to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as sugar, salt, rice, beans, lightbulbs, oil, milk, refreshments, toothpaste, pasta for soup, water, soap, etc.

Minerva’s goal is to expand the business, to buy a display case and shelves to stock more products. She has also been thinking of saving to buy a computer for her children.

“Thanks very much to Visión Fund and the Kiva funders for their trust in me and for helping me to continue investing in my little store.”

The members of this group and the work that each one engages in are:

María: soft drink warehouse
Francisca: selling groceries
Minerva: selling groceries
Benjamin: selling groceries
Francisco: florist
Maximina: selling food
Rosa: poultry

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of sugar, salt, rice, beans, lightbulbs, oil, milk, soft drinks, toothpaste, pasta for soup, water, soap, etc.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with six children and only one of her children goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (two orphans and her grandchildren.)

She operates a shop and operates it on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She also gets additional income from rental houses. She has been in business for the last 10 years.

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, rice, flour, boxes of  soap, mineral water and crates of soda. Her major business challenges are ever increasing prices of commodities,   transportation, and seasonality. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and   building more rental rooms is her dream. She lives in her own house and the  family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap, bags of sugar, rice and maize flour, mineral water and crates of soda

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla lives in the town of Kwale with his wife, who is a housewife, and his two children. He is a retailer: he sells consumable goods such as wheat flour, maize flour and rice. He started his business one year ago. 

Abdalla started by selling charcoal and also farming.  His goal for the future is to buy a house of his own. Abdalla and his wife are very determined to attain this goal in order to give their children a better quality of life and help them become successful. 

Abdalla is asking for a Kiva loan, his first loan, with field partner Yehu Microfinance Trust, in order to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Villa Mercedez Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento VILLA MERCEDEZ  está  compuesto por diez integrantes, ocho mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Shirley tiene 34 años y tiene su pareja con el que tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de  3años y 2años, su actividad es la  venta de carne hace ya varios años, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.   Shirley  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de carne y así de esta manera aumentar  su capital de trabajo,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra.  Shirley enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ya que en la zona donde vende existe muchas personas que venden carne, con la diferencia que la Sra. tiene muchos clientes por el buen trato que les da ya que ella es una persona amable y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio y ella desea a la larga poder tener una tienda en el mercado por donde ella vive. La Sra. Shirley es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank VILLA MERCEDEZ is composed of 10 members, 8 women and 2 men. The president of the bank is Shirley, 34 years old, who with her partner has two children - 2 and 3 years of age. She has worked in the sale of meat for many years, and this loan is her first with this institution. Shirley will use this loan for the purchase of meat, and in this way increase her working capital. The reason she is asking for this loan is a lack of working capital. Shirley faces challenges in her business including competition - as there are many people who sell meat in the area where she sells - however she has many clients because of the good treatment she gives them and because she is a very friendly person. She is going to use the benefits of this loan to continue improving her business, and she wishes to be able to have a store in the market near where she lives in the longer term. Shirley is a very hardworking person and she is happy for the opportunity provided to her and her group mates, especially since in some cases they are the sole providers for their families.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk

loans.name: Victorino Asuncion

texts.es: Victorino  casado de sesenta y un años de edad con tres hijos menores de edad  tiene un negocio de  mercaderia en general desde hace trece años que cuenta con la experiencia en dicho negocio, su ubicación de trabajo es de forma ambulante, se inico con esfuerzo propio con ahorro que tiene de la venta de unas tierra como agricultor, y gracia al apoyo que fundacion leon 2000 le ha brindado  ha podido invertir en el negocio y asi poder sasfifacer la demanda de sus clientes, su sueños en un futuro son de terminar de construir su casa para el bienestar de toda su familia, con el prestamo pretendo compra mercaderia como : ropa de niños, blusas de dama, pantalones de adultos,  juego de sabanas, zapatos, ropa interior entre otros.
texts.en: Victorino, married, 60 years old with 3 young children, has a business selling general merchandise. He has had experience with this business for the past three years. He works selling items door-to-door, and began through his own efforts with savings he had from the sale of some agricultural land. Thanks to the support of the Fundacion Leon, he has been able to invest in his business and thereby satsfy the demands of his clients. His dreams for the future include completing the construction of his house for the well-being of his family. With this loan he will buy merchandise such as children's clothes, women's blouses, adult pants, sheet sets, shoes, and underwear among other items.

loans.use: to buy: children's clothes, women's blouses, adult pants, sheet sets, shoes, and underwear among other items

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 37-year-old business lady, married to Michael who is a businessman, and they are blessed with two children aged 21 and 15 years old. She has been in a livestock trading business for the past four years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Florence is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to purchase more goats and sheep for rearing and future selling. With the anticipated profits from the business she will save towards the education of her children. 

She dreams of being able to buy a pick-up for transporting livestock to different markets.

loans.use: To purchase more goats and sheep for resale

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 49-year-old businessman, married to Lucy who is a business lady. They are blessed with three children aged 22, 18 and 15 years. He has been running a medical clinic for the past 19 years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Patrick will use the loan to purchase a piece of land for future use. With the anticipated profit from the clinic business he will educate his children. 

He hopes to build rental houses and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 34-year-old, married man with two children.

To earn a living, he runs a retail shop as well as a taxi business, which has been in operation for three years. The businesses enable him to earn an income of approximately 60,000 KES per month.

This would be his first loan with KADET, and he plans to use the proceeds to purchase additional sugar and rice for the retail shop and fuel for the taxi business. He will use the profits from the businesses to educate his children. In the future, he wants to be able to pay for all of his family's basic needs and expenses.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods (rice and sugar) for his retail business and fuel for his transportation business

loans.name: Esmilda Lorena

texts.es: Esmilda tiene 41 años de edad y vive en Libertad con su familia. Su esposo es chofer profesional y sus hijos son mayores de edad, tienen a su cargo al menor de 15 años que estudia en el colegio fiscal. Esmilda se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes, el negocio lo empezó gracias a su esposo quien le dio $ 200 como capital para que empezara. Han pasado 5 años desde que inicio vendiendo únicamente a crédito. Actualmente vende a crédito y contado bisutería, ropa unisex, pantalones, perfumes .El trabajo lo realiza sola únicamente en las tardes, recorre el sector visitando a sus clientes. Algunos también la llaman y concuerda visitas en el horario que dispongan, de esta manera le ha beneficiado más. Esmilda nos comenta que su mayor problema es la delincuencia ya que regresa tarde a su domicilio. Si obtiene el crédito comprara mercadería para tener en stock, esto lo realiza porque muchas veces hay ofertas o promociones que debe aprovechar para obtener más ganancias. El sueno de Esmilda es poder abrir un bazar pero en su domicilio para descansar de los recorridos.
texts.en: Esmilda is 41 years old and lives in Libertad with her family. Her husband is a professional chauffer and her children are older, but they take care of the youngest who is 15 and studies in public school. Esmilda dedicates herself to the sale of clothing and perfumes, and started the business thanks to her husband who gave her $200 as capital to start it. 5 years have passed since she began selling only on credit. Currently she sells jewelry, unisex clothing, pants and perfumes on a credit and cash basis. She does her work alone in the afternoons, and goes about her area visiting her clients. Some also call her and arrange visits in their free time, and in this way she has additionally benefited. Esmilda tells us that her biggest problem is delinquincy as she arrives home late. If she obtains this loan, she will buy merchandise to have in stock, which she does because many times there are special offers or promotions that she should take advantage of to obtain greater earnings. Esmilda's dream is to be able to open a store in her home so she can rest from all of the running around that she does.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, unisex clothing, pants, and perfumes

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 28-year-old pig farmer. He is married to Rita who is a mixed crop farmer and they are blessed with three children aged 12, 8 and 5 years. He has been rearing pigs and later reselling them at a profit for the past six years with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Lawrence will use the loan to buy a pig and feed. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

He hopes to own a large pig farm and improve the living standards of his family in future.

loans.use: To buy a pig and feed

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is a father of three children. He lives in Kwale, Kenya and sells fruit and vegetables. He has gained important experience in handling perishable products. Saidi's business has allowed him to get ahead, to have his rental houses, and to earn enough income to have some comforts. His goal is to expand his business more so that his children can obtain a good quality education and be successful in whatever they endeavor. 

Saidi is currently planning to take out his first Kiva loan, which will also be his first funding through Yehu Microfinance Trust. He will use it to buy fruit like watermelons, which are one of the fruits he sells the most of. He generates good profits when he buys in bulk, which is what he plans to do in this instance.

loans.use: to buy fruit like watermelons.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 31-year-old man. He is married to Jane.

To earn a living, he runs a butcher shop and a food kiosk, which have been in business for five years. The businesses enable him to earn approximately 31,900 KES per month.

This would be his first loan from KADET, and he plans to use the proceeds to purchase more meat for the butcher shop and sugar, flour, and rice for the food kiosk. He also plans to use the anticipated profits he expects to generate from the businesses as a result of the loan to expand his retail shop. In the future, he hopes to be able to open another branch of the butcher shop and additional food kiosks in other areas.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items (meat, sugar, flour, and rice) for his businesses

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is aged 25, living in the Northern province of Zambia in a town called Mbala. She runs a mobile money transfer business and has been running this business since early 2012. Her business is her only source of income.

She is a hard-working person who has been able to increase the commissions she gets from the money transfer transactions by doing extensive direct selling to her community. Her shop is centrally located and this, she says, helps her get a good number of customers. She is convinced that her business is what her customers need because it brings the service to the community and it is easy to use as well as cheaper than the same service offered by commercial banks.

Esther faces two challenges in running her business; the first one is that she does not have enough money to run her business smoothly, so most of the time she has to close her trading booth and run to the bank to get some cash and make some deposits to serve her customers. The second one is that the Internet connection on her phone can sometimes be terrible and so she would like to buy an external Internet modem to make her transactions even faster.

Because serving all her customers and the growth of her business is very important to her, Esther wants to use the loan money to add to her small working capital and also employ one person to assist her with her day-to-day transactions. This will mean that Esther will earn more profits.

Earning more profits will improve Esther’s standard of living, as this business is her only source of income.

loans.use: To add to her small working capital and employ one person to assist her with her day-to-day transactions

loans.name: Ekome Feamo Group

texts.en:
Ekome Feamo is a group of six women who sell fish, cooking oil, beans, maize and cassava. Their average age is 35 years and their average number of children is three. They all sell at the central market in Accra.

Faustina is the leader of this group. She sells beans, maize and cooking oil. She is standing in the middle of the front row. Her ambition is to own a commercial vehicle. She will make a profit of 90 GHS monthly.

They need 2,500 GHS to operate their businesses adequately.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Hacia Adelante 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria is one of the members of the group Hacia adelante (Going Forward) 1, 2, 3 & 4. This group is located in a community called La Caleta, close to one of the famous beaches in Dominican Republic and the main airport, which gives Maria the opportunity to live in a community outside of San Pedro de Macoris with a lot going on, people trading or accessing various sources of employment. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She operates a cybercafe with photocopying, computers, Internet, scanning and other services, and she also has a stall where she sells miscellaneous products.

Maria is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for six years, and she started with her own capital after saving for a while. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing some hardware, expendable materials, and some miscellaneous products like cosmetics, women's accessories and jewelry. She says that her most difficult challenges are to improve her business and to help her family. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying cooking for her family.

loans.use: To buy expendable materials for cybercafe and other miscellaneous products.

loans.name: El Arroyo (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Este es un nuevo grupo llamado El Arroyo; está integrado por tres personas quienes vive en un lugar llamado  Luis Espinoza.

Gabriel vive en unión libre con la señora Flor Magnolia, madre de sus 2 hijos: Marily y Gabriel.

Él solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de ganado, actividad en la cual lleva trabajando 4 años y medio. Menciona que le ha ido bien en este negocio pues con las ganancias ha estado sosteniendo a su pequeña familia. Gabriel inició esta actividad ya que tenía algunos ahorros y decidió hacer trabajar su dinero para así incrementarlo un poco más junto con la ayuda de su esposa quien se dedica a hacer pasteles. Lo que más desea es que con su actividad y el préstamo, pueda seguir trabajando y así poder darle lo más necesario a sus pequeños que están creciendo.

Quienes integran en el grupo son: Esaú, quien invertirá en su negocio de venta de pescado y la señora Otilia quien invertirá en la compra y venta de ganado.
texts.en:
This is a new group called El Arroyo which is made up of three people who live in a place called Luis Espinoza. 

Gabriel lives in a common law marriage with Flor Magnolia, mother of his 2 children: Marily and Gabriel. He sought the loan to invest in the purchase and sale of cattle, an activity in which he has been working for 4 years and a half. He mentions that this business has been going well for him as he has been supporting his small family with the profits. Gabriel started this activity as he had some savings and he decided to make his money work to make it increase a bit more, along with the support of his wife who makes her living making cakes. What he wants the most that with this activity and the loan, is to continue working and in that way give his children who are growing what they need most. 

The people who make up the group are: Esaú, who will invest in his business selling fish and Otilia who will invest in the purchase and sale of cattle.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of cattle.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Katupyry se conformó en el año 2010, se encuentra en el 8º ciclo gracias a su arduo trabajo y ayuda mutua. Ellas son mujeres muy emprendedoras y con ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una de las miembros de este grupo es la Sra. Maxima quien se dedica al cultivo y venta de verduras y frutilla. Cuenta ella que gracias a este trabajo ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia pese a todos los desafíos que día a día surgen. Su meta es poder ser una gran microempresaria y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras de todo tipo, como ser tomates, locotes, cebollas y demás tipos, con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y surtiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women known as Kuña Katupyry was formed in 2010.  They are in their eighth cycle thanks to their arduous work and mutual support.  They are very enterprising women who have a desire to get ahead in life and to help each other.  

One of the members of this group is Señora Maxima who makes a living through the cultivation and sale of vegetables and small fruit.   She says that thanks to this work she has been able to get ahead and help her family despite all the struggles that arise each day.  Her goal is to be a great small business owner and thus be able to continue supporting her family.  She asks for this loan to purchase vegetables of all kinds, like tomatoes, green peppers, onions, etc., with which she can continue working and supplying to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula has three children, two of whom attend school, while one is still too young for school.

To earn a living, she sells various food products -- such as green vegetables, tomatoes, citrus fruit -- and retail products to her neighbors and local small businesses. She explains that she began her work as a merchant two years ago with the goal of working on her own to support her household. With very little education, she thought a career as a merchant would ultimately allow her to succeed and would enable her to improve her family's standard of living. Her long-term goal is to educate her children so that they can become successful and happy individuals.

Currently, she plans to grow her business in a gradual manner. That is why she is coming to Kiva for a loan, which would be her first loan via Yehu Microfinance Trust. She plans to use the loan proceeds to purchase sacks of green vegetables, onions, tomatoes, and potatoes. Based on her business experience, she feels that this investment would improve and expand her business because there is a great deal of market demand for these products.

loans.use: to purchase additional food items such as sacks of green vegetables, onions, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her sister, who also goes to school. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include various fees, food expenses, and rent.

To earn a living, she sells sweet bananas in the evening by the roadside. She has been in this business for the last six years, working seven days per week. During the day, she cleans roads in the city center.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more bunches of bananas for sale. Her business challenges include seasonality, transportation costs, and thieves. Her dream is to sell sweet bananas at wholesale prices to other vendors. She would also like to build her own house . She joined MCDT because the interest the organization charges on loans is low when compared to other money lending institutions.

loans.use: To purchase additional sweet bananas for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is married and has two children. Jocelyn is 28 years old and lives at Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She operates a fish selling business for a living and she's been 4 years in this business. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Jocelyn been a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Jocelyn wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is from Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old. Gina is married and has five children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a sari-sari or general store. Gina has been in her business for 5 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Gina joined GDMPC. 

Gina is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soap, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay for tuition for her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (breakfast drink), shampoo, soap, etc

location.town: Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 44-year-old married woman living in Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has a child who assists her sometimes in feeding and caring for the animals. The small piggery she is working on at this time commenced two years ago. While not her only source of income, Alma earns a total of about PHP 3,000 a month.

 Alma joined GDMPC in 2011. She is applying for a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase feeding supplies for piglets. She wants to give them the best possible nourishment so as not to be hesitant in naming the price when selling them. The profit generated from this investment is planned for buying more piglets to gain more income and improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies for piglets.

loans.name: Amparo Consepcion

texts.es: Amparo de 34 años se dedica a la recolección y venta de tagua. Vive en la ciudad de Manta donde tiene su casa de cemento y cuenta con los servicios básicos. Es separada pero tiene a su cargo a sus dos hijos quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal. Amparo nos cuenta que el negocio lo empezó por sus padres, quienes le enseñaron la recolección y el tratamiento del producto. Ella nos explica que la tagua o marfil vegetal se obtiene del endosperma blanco y duro, de las semillas de la palmera Phytelephas sp, de la familia Arecaceae. El endosperma pulido de la semilla se parece muchísimo al marfil, a pesar de sus propiedades completamente distintas. En Ecuador, la especie utilizada para la obtención de tagua es Phitelephas aequatorialis, que existe en la zona subtropical entre los Andes y la Costa especialmente en la provincia de Manabí. También la tagua se la procesa como harina de tagua la cual sirve como alimento para animales como ganado, cerdos, aves. Se estima que, en 1920, un 20% de los botones producidos en los Estados Unidos eran hechos de tagua, procedentes principalmente de Ecuador, Colombia y Panamá. En la actualidad lo que más se confecciona son botones y figuras decorativas de animales los cuales son muy preciados por el turista. En la recolección y venta la ayudan sus hijos en sus ratos libres, agradece mucho su ayuda ya que es un poco pesado el trasporte de estos productos. El préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de utensilios que se utilizan para el proceso de pulido. En próximos años le gustaría comprar un vehículo para mejorar el transporte de su negocio.
texts.en: Amparo, 34 years old, is dedicated to the collection and sale of tagua seeds. She lives in the city of Manta where she has her cement house with basic services. She is separated but is in charge of her two children who study in public school. Amparo tells us that the business was started by her parents, who taught her how to collect and treat her product. She explains to us that the hard and white seed, almost like ivory, is obtained from the seeds of the Phytelephas palm. The polished endosperm of the seed looks much like ivory, despite having completely distinct properties. In Ecuador, the species used for obtaining the tagua seed is phitelephas aequatorialis, which exists in the subtropical region between the Andes and the coast especially in the province of Manabi. Additionally, the tagua seeds can be processed like flour which can then be used to feed animals like cows, pigs and birds. It is estimated that in 1920, some 20% of buttons produced in the United States were made of tagua, principally from Ecuador, Colombia and Panama. Currently, it is mostly used to make buttons and decorative animal figures which are highly sought after by tourists. Her children help her to collect and sell in their spare time, and she is very grateful for their help as it can become quite heavy to transport these products. She will invest this loan in the purchase of utensils which can be used during the polishing process. In the coming years she would like to buy a vehicle to improve transportation for her business.

loans.use: to buy tagua seeds and polishing utensils

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidas lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas Lidia quien está casada con Pedro, trabajador de la zona franca y con el que tiene cuatro hijos. Ella vende tortillas y granos básicos desde hace 7 años e invertirá el crédito en la compra de maíz y leña.
Las otras integrantes son Vilma quien se dedica al destace de cerdo desde hace 8 años y Juana quien vende ropa y perfumes desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The Unidas group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising women. One of these women is Lidia, married to Pedro who works in the free trade zone. They have four children. Lidia has been selling tortillas and basic grains for seven years and will invest the loan in buying corn and firewood.

The other members of Unidas are Vilma, who has worked as a pig butcher for eight years, and Juana, who has sold clothes and perfume for three years.

loans.use: to buy corn and basic grains

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child, and she is currently in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in rented house, where her family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

To earn a living, she sells second-hand clothes at the market. She explains that she works seven days per week, and that she has been in this business for the last six years.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 200,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges include insufficient capital and seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business into wholesale clothing sales business. She would also like to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase additional used clothing for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Dennis Francisco

texts.es:
Dennis es un joven de 21 años de edad, muy trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, así como también se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de esparrago, uva, algodón, paprika, entre otros.
