Now she is leading her group of two to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy feeds for her pigs. She hopes this loan will enable her to feed her pigs to be fat and healthy and also hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
For over ten years, Juana, a 57-year-old married woman, has made a living through the operation of a fruits and vegetables selling stand in Garang, Tangub City. She earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Juana joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase more fruits and vegetables. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: La  señora Mercedes continua  con el cultivo de Piña  este nuevo préstamo lo solicita para comprar Fertilizante e insumos ya  que  con las primeras lluvias parte del cultivo se le daño  y esta llenándose de  plagas, debido a eso  tiene  perdidas en la parcela .  Lo   cual    necesita con urgencias aplicar  abono a los cultivos  para que en la próxima producción sea más  rentable.  Agradece la confianza que Afodenic le  ha brindado para  seguir trabajando en la producción.
texts.en:
Mercedes continues to grow pineapples, and is requesting this new loan in order to purchase fertilizer and supplies, since after the first rainfall, part of her crops were damaged and are filling with pests. For this reason, she has suffered losses in her plot of land, so she needs to urgently apply fertilizer to her crops so that their next yield is more profitable. 
She wants to thank Afodenic for the trust they have deposited in her so that she may keep working on production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en: Arlen is 33 years old and is a married woman with children. She runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. Each month, Arlen earns 3,000 PHP selling canned goods, sugar, soy sauce, vinegar and snack foods to her community. Arlen works hard to keep her customers loyal and increase her sales. She hopes to expand her inventory and increase her profit. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods. Arlen hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: Melba is from Silanga, Tangub City. She is 40 years old. She is married and has four children. Melba used her last loan to purchase additional products to sell. Her business has grown up and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase additional fish to sell. She hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Sangke district, Sitha is 48 years old and is married with three children, two daughters and one son who are still in school. She and her husband earn a living through raising pigs and selling ice cream in the village. She has been in this business for five years. In addition to this, her husband is a teacher. The main challenge for her business is the illness of the pig and low demand for ice cream, especially in rainy season.

This is the fourth loan for Sitha’s group of two members and they successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund. The past loans have helped Sitha afford to buy pigs and a motorbike for her family. Now, she can earn around 12,000 KHR per day from her current business. With a good business, she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy three more pigs for her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her pig business so as to increase her family’s income and improve its standard of living.

loans.use: to buy three more pigs for her business.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger es un joven trabajador de 19 años. Vive en la casa de sus padres, y su mayor anhelo es salir adelante. 
Se dedica a laborar en los campos de cultivo que sus padres le dieron como herencia. Actualmente siembra plantas de café, ya que es el producto más rentable en su zona. Trabaja muy duro porque su deseo es poder comprar otro terreno agrícola y cultivar en mayor cantidad y poder pagar sus estudios profesionales. Nos cuenta que si descuida sólo un momento su chacra podría ser atacada por las plagas. Por tal motivo, está en constante supervisión, limpieza y fertilización de sus plantas.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se siente muy agradecido de la oportunidad que le dan para seguir con sus planes de trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago y no quedar mal con su banco comunal. 
Con el préstamo de 1,500 nuevos soles solicitado comprará abono para mantener fuertes sus plantas de café.
texts.en: Roger is a young worker, 19 years old.  He lives in his parents' house, and his greatest desire is to get ahead.  He works in the fields that his parents gave him as an inheritance.  He is currently planting coffee plants, as this is the most profitable product in his zone.  He works very hard because his wish is to buy another plot of land and plant more so that he can pay for his professional studies.  He tells us that if he neglects it for only a moment his farm could be attacked by pests.  For this reason, he is constantly supervising, cleaning and fertilizing his plants.  This is his first loan with MFP, and he is very happy for the opportunity to continue with his work plans.  Likewise, he commits to making his loan payments punctually and not making a bad impression on his communal bank.  With the loan of 1,500 nuevos soles requested he will buy fertilizer to keep his coffee plants strong.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee plants.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina tiene 54 años, está casada con Ángel, de 58 años, y en 20 años de casados llegaron a comprar la casa donde viven ahora con sus dos hijos: Miryan de 21 años y Reyder de 24 años. 
Ella es muy activa, está permanentemente atendiendo su tienda de abarrotes, donde vende variedad de productos comestibles. Este negocio lo empezó hace 23 años y desde entonces le ha dado muy buenos resultados, ya que siempre le genera ingresos para solventar los gastos de su familia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su hija, quien le ayuda en la atención de los clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad es poder ofrecer los productos que le piden sus clientes y tener su tienda limpia y presentable. Para más adelante desea vender al por mayor, pero ahora prioriza en abastecerse de mercadería.

Este es su crédito número 19  con MFP, empezó a trabajar con esta microfinanciera, hace varios años, y una vez más se siente agradecida por contar con el apoyo y la confianza de las personas. De igual forma, se compromete a seguir siendo puntual y no quedar mal con su banco comunal. 
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados implementará su negocio comprando más abarrotes.
texts.en:
Sabina is 54 years old and married to 58 year old Angel.  In 20 years of marriage they managed to buy the house where they now live with their two children, 21 year old Miryan and 24 year old Reyder.

She is very active and constantly manning her grocery store, where she sells a variety of food products.  This business began 23 years ago and since then it has provided very good results and always generates income for her so that she can pay the family expenses.  She gets help from her daughter who helps her serve customers.  What she likes most is being able to offer products requested by her customers and keeping her store clean and presentable.  In the future she wants to sell in quantity but for now her priority is stocking her store.

This will be her 19th loan through MFP.  She began working with the microfinance organization several years ago and she is grateful for being able to count on the support and trust.  She also commits to be punctual and not getting in bad with the communal bank.

She will use the 2,000 PEN to stock her business with more groceries.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is married. She is 55 years old and resides at Tiaman, Bonifacio, Philippines. Gloria owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living, and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 4,900 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next cropping. In 2008, Gloria joined GDMPC. In the future, Gloria wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next cropping.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 50 years old and is a married woman with two children, who are 26 and 17 years old. She has had a sari-sari store business for 20 years now. She sells items like eggs, softdrinks, snack foods and toiletries. Bebiana is able to support her family through her business. She works hard to increase her income and to elevate her family's standard of living.

Bebiana is requesting a loan to buy additional items to sell such as rice, canned goods and toiletries. Bebiana hopes for this loan to help grow her business and to improve her family's living.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as rice, canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of snacks, detergents, shampoo and soft drinks

loans.name: Sam Ath's Group

texts.en:
A 29-year-old mother of one daughter, Sam Ath is a rice farmer living in a rural village of the Sangke district of Cambodia. She has been farming a 3-hectare farmland for three years and she supplements her income by selling fruits. The main challenge for her family’s business is the low crop yield resulting from the flood.

Sam Ath’s group consists of two female members, and she is the third cycled client while her group member is the fourth cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. After the loans, she will be happy with her business and is confident that she will make her living better. With her current business, she manages to earn around 14,200 KHR per day to support her family. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy more fruits for her fruit business. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en:
Sovann is 60 years old and widowed. She has four children and lives in a rural village located in the Sangke district. She has been earning a living by farming rice and selling vegetables for more than ten years. Sovann has been challenged by the low harvest that resulted from flooding, the main challenge to her business.

Sovann's group consists of two members who live in the same village. She is in her second loan cycle while her group member is in her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund. With her current business, Sovann is able to earn around 12,000 KHR per day. 

Now, as the leader of her group applying for a loan, Sovann will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and will also spend a portion of it on land preparation. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es una mujer muy activa de 49 años. Vive en la casa que, con gran esfuerzo, logró obtener junto a su esposo Juan, de 52 años. Tienen dos hijas: Danay de 12 años y Rocío de 9 años. 
A Teodosia le gusta el comercio, por ello implementó una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda. Esta labor la empezó hace 4 años y durante todo ese tiempo le ha ido muy bien. Se encarga de la administración y la atención de los clientes. Los problemas que la aquejan son cuando se van terminando su productos y no tiene cómo satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes. Ella consigue su mercadería en la ciudad, para conseguir menores precios, pero tiene que viajar por largas horas. Con el tiempo, desea vender al por mayor y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se siente agradecida con las personas que la apoyan y confían para que siga logrando mejoras en su negocio. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por permitirle el ingreso al grupo, pues son personas solidarias.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles de este préstamo se abastecerá de más productos para su tienda (arroz, azúcar, conservas, bebidas, variedades de detergentes, jabones, etc.)
texts.en:
Teodosia is a very active 49-year-old woman. She lives in the home which she and her husband Juan, who is 52, were able to acquire through much effort. They have two daughters: Danay, who is 12 years old, and Rocío, who is 9. 

Teodosia likes commercial activity, which is why she set up a grocery store in her home. She started this business four years ago and it has gone very well during all this time. She is in charge of both management and customer service. The problems that afflict her come when she starts running out of products and she has no way of satisfying her customers' needs. She gets her merchandise from the city, in order to obtain lower prices, but she has to travel long hours. In time, she hopes to sell wholesale and improve her financial income.

This is her first loan with MFP, so she feels grateful to the people who support her and trust her to keep improving her business. She also wants to thank her communal bank for admitting her into the group, because they are supportive people.

She will use this loan's 1,500 nuevos soles to stock up on more products for her store (rice, sugar, preserves, drinks, a variety of detergents, soaps, etc.)

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von is 32 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Von has been involved in distilling and breeding pigs for more than four years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 per day. Her children are still in her care. 

Due to the difficulties in her family's transportation, Von is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved for her transportation expenses to support her family. 

In the future, Von would like to expand her pig farm and help her children earn bachelor's degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her current house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Cheat's Group

texts.en:
Cheat is 60 years old and widowed. She lives in a village located in the Sangke district of Cambodia. She has six children, four of whom are dependent and work in the family’s business. Her primary source of income is from the cassava plantation of the eight-hectare farmland. She has been in this business for several years. The main challenge for her family’s business is a drop in the price of cassava.

This is the third loan for Cheat with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, and she has completely paid back the loans with VisionFund. After the loans, she is now able to earn around 12,500 KHR per day for daily expenses. She is leading her group of two members to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Cheat is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields and make a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela earns a living through buying bananas, yams, and taro and reselling them to her community. She earns 2000 PHP per month with her small business. Daniela works hard to support her family - a husband and 2 children. 

Daniela has requested a loan to buy more bananas, yams, and taro to sell. She hopes to have increased sales and profitability. She hopes to be able to help improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, yams, and taro to sell.

loans.name: Yene

texts.es:
Yene tiene 21 años y es una joven muy empeñosa. Su casa está hecha de madera, y la obtuvo a base de mucho trabajo junto a su pareja Wilmer, de 24 años. Tienen una pequeña hija de tres añitos llamada Juliana, a quien le brindan amor y cuidado.
Por la mañana, ella ayuda a Wilmer en las labores de la chacra, pero en tarde, después de las 5PM empieza su labor. Se dedica a vender pollo frito en un carrito especial para estas comidas, el cual compraron para que ambos tengan ingresos económicos. Esta labor la empezó hace un año, y menciona que le va muy bien, ya que gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos que generan en su hogar. Con el tiempo, desea abrir un restaurante, pero sabe que para ello, debe lograr mejores ingresos económicos con su actual negocio para que realice sus objetivos futuros.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se siente contenta de haber recibido nuevamente el apoyo y confianza de las personas. Por lo que se compromete a seguir siendo puntual con sus cuotas, como en su anterior crédito. 
Con el préstamo que ahora solicita comprará ollas, una mesa y un sartén grande para freír sus pollos y papas.
texts.en:
Yene is 21 years old and is a very hard-working young woman. Her house is made of wood; she and her 24-year-old partner, Wilmer, obtained the house through lots of hard work. They have a little three-year-old daughter named Juliana to whom they give their love and attention.

In the mornings, Yene helps Wilmer with the farm work, but in the afternoons, after 5:00 p.m., she begins her own work. She works selling fried chicken from a special food cart, which she bought so that both of them could bring in income. She began this work a year ago, and says that it's going very well; thanks to her work, she can pay their household expenses. With time, she hopes to open a restaurant, but she knows that she must earn more money with her current business in order to realize her future goals.

This is Yene's second loan with MFP, and she is glad to have once again received people's support and confidence. In turn, she commits to continue being punctual with her payments, as she was for her previous loan.

With the loan that she is currently requesting, she will buy pots, a table, and a large frying pan for frying chicken and potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs and cooking equipment for her food stand.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Thmor Koul district, Chanthy is 33 years old and married with five children who are still in school. For the last three years, she has been raising pigs and making wine to earn a living. The main challenge to her family's business is the lack of working capital to support the business. 

Chanthy received her first loan with VisionFund three cycles ago and completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her afford to buy more pigs and necessary household items. She is now leading her group of three to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Chanthy is going to use her portion to buy equipment to fix her house and winemaking store. She hopes to increase her family’s income so as to keep her children in school and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy equipment to fix her house and winemaking store

loans.name: Nonvignon C1 Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON C1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Rose-Claire (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Félicien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rose-Claire a fréquenté l’école et s’est arrêté au niveau secondaire. Rose-Claire vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près d’une vingtaine d’année, Rose-Claire vend des tissus et des chaussures à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Rose-Claire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin.  C’est la quatrième fois que Rose-Claire et les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON C1  sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The NONVIGNON C1 group consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood. 

The group's representative, Rose-Claire, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. She is 41 years old and married to a man named Félicien.  Rose-Claire and her husband have four children, all in school and all their dependents.  Rose-Claire has attended school up to the secondary level and lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses. 

Rose-Claire has been selling fabrics and shoes from home and through the distribution system, for almost twenty years.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.  

It is the fourth time that Rose-Claire and the other members of the NONVIGNON C1 group are requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to boost their working capital and their activity, and to better meet their customers' demand.  Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes.

loans.name: Zenón

texts.es:
Zenón tiene 32 años, es un hombre muy alegre, y gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo logró comprar un terreno donde construyó su casa a base de material rústico, que es donde ahora vive con su pareja Cinthia, de 21 años, y sus dos hijos.

A una hora de la ciudad de San Francisco, Ayacucho hay una comunidad donde acuden  bastantes transportistas llevando pasajeros, es ahí donde Zenón tiene su restaurante,  donde ofrece exquisitos platos para el gusto de todos. Esta labor la realiza junto a su pareja desde hace 6 años y comenta que le va muy bien, gracias a su buena atención y comodidad que brinda. Este trabajo le gusta mucho, tiene una gran simpatía con la gente, por eso acuden a su restaurante. Sus planes a futuro son de seguir creciendo en lo que mejor sabe hacer, y tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, por lo que agradece a las personas que nuevamente apoyan y confían en sus planes de trabajo. Asimismo, se siente contento de laborar con sus compañeros de su banco comunal. 
Con el actual préstamo comprará mesas, platos, vasos y demás utensilios para su restaurante.
texts.en: Zenón is a very happy 32-year-old man, and thanks to his hard work at his job he was able to purchase some land where he built his home with simple materials. He lives there with his wife Cinthia, 21, and their two children. An hour from the city of San Francisco, Ayacucho is a community visited by many buses carrying passengers. It's here Zenón has his restaurant offering exquisite meals for all to enjoy. He has carried out this work alongside his wife for the past six years and says that it is going very well thanks to the good service and comfort he provides. He really enjoys the work and has great rapport with people, which is why they come to his restaurant. His plans for the future are to keep growing the business the best he knows how and to improve his quality of life. This is his sixth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he thanks you once again for supporting him and having faith in his plans. He also is happy to work with his fellow members of his community bank. With this loan, he plans to purchase tables, plates, glasses and other utensils for his restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase tables and utensils for his restaurant.

loans.name: Julia Damiana

texts.es:
Doña Julia sigue con su negocio de venta de maiz y venta de tortillas, pues desde que su esposo cosecho en tierras de un cuñado el maiz, continuo vendiendo por quintal y libra, siendo uno de los grano mas demandado en el comercio, su esposo esta laborando de conductor en casa particular, asi mismo sus hijos estudian.
Con este prestamo sera para cambio de techo, ya que esta viejo con el uso de los años. Comprando zinc, perlines, golosos y hacer el cambio, tenieno mejor regosijo al no pasarce el agua, en este invierno.
texts.en:
Julia continues with her business of selling corn and tortillas; since her husband harvested corn from a brother-in-law's land, she has been selling it by the pound or quintal [100 lbs], as it is one of the most in-demand grains in the business. Her husband is working as a driver in a private household; that way their children can study.

This loan will be to replace the roof, given that it is worn out with years of use. She will buy metal sheeting, beams, and screws and replace the roof, and they will be so glad when no water comes in this winter.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, beams, and screws to replace the roof.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Ek Phnom district, Hing is 50 years old and married. To make a living, she and her husband have been planting cassava on two hectares of farmland, as well as maize, cabbage and cucumber, for several years. The main challenge to her family's business is the poor health of the crops.

This is Hing's third loan with VisionFund, and she has completely paid back her past loans, which have helped sustain her business and increase her household's income. Now, she is able to earn around 59,000 KHR per day from her business. Now requesting a third loan, Hing wants to use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Ahos-Si Group

texts.fr: AHOS-SI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Agnès (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Olivier. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Agnès n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Agnès vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Agnès vend divers produits (produits de beauté, chaussures, et médicaments) de façon ambulante et à son domicile. Agnès s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Agnès et les autres membres du groupe AHOS-SI sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The AHOS-SI group consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood.

The group's representative, Agnès, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. She is 38 years old and married to a welder named Olivier. Agnès and her husband have four children, all in school and all their dependents. Agnès has not attended school.  She lives with her husband and children. The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.

Agnès has been selling various goods (beauty products, shoes, medications) from home and also as an itinerant vendor, for almost ten years. She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

It is the second time that Agnès and the other members of the AHOS-SI group are requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to boost their working capital and their activity, and to better meet their customers' demand. Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, medications and shoes.

loans.name: El Renacer Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “El Renacer” está conformado por 19 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente feriantes, venta de comida rápida, venta de ropa, venta de sopaipillas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes  a la comuna de San Bernardo ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Heny, presidenta del grupo del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila de derecha a izquierda, viste con una polera de color blanco y encima lleva puesto una chaqueta de color verde, usa aros y su pelo es de color rojo y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente a la venta de ropa, desde hace 22 años. Su puesto lo ubica en ferias libres, los días martes, sábados y domingos. Su mercadería en ropa es diversa, ya que generalmente sus productos son para todas las edades y personas.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en la comuna de Estación Central, ya que la conocen y le dejan la mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará más ropa de niños, chalecos de diferentes modelos y tallas.
Sus metas son poder establecer un local para mejorar la atención de su clientela, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Heny vive junto a su padre, nuera, nieta y sus 6 hijos de 8, 10, 12, 14, 18 y  21 quienes se encuentran todos estudiando. Sus sueños son obtener una casa propia en la cual pueda vivir con todos sus hijos y mantener el calor de hogar que hasta ahora ha mantenido con ellos.
Heny está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta  que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad  y unidad.
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called El Renacer.  It is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who work in the area of commerce, specifically market vendors, fast food, clothing sales, "sopaipillas" [deep-fried dough], and service, among others.  All of them live in San Bernardo, located in the city of Santiago.

Heny is the president of the communal bank group.  In the photo she is seated in the first row on the right.  She's wearing a white polo shirt and a green jacket.  She is wearing earrings and her hair is red and she wears it pulled up.

She has worked for 22 years in the area of commerce, specifically selling clothing.  She sets up her stall in open markets on Tuesday, Saturday, and Sunday.  Her clothing merchandise is varied because generally her products are for all ages and people.  She usually buys her merchandise in the town of Estación Central because they know her and they give her the merchandise at a low cost, which is convenient economically.

With the loan she will buy more children's clothing and different models and styles of vests.

Heny lives with her father, daughter-in-law, granddaughter, and her six children, ages 8, 10, 12, 14, 18, and 21, who are all in school.  Her dreams are to get her own house where she can live with all her children and keep the warmth of her home that she has had with them up to now.

Heny is very happy and grateful for the loan and services provided by Fondo Esperanza.  She also comments that she feels very comfortable with the meetings and the communal bank group because there is generosity and unity.

San Bernardo is a city located 18 kilometers directly south of the Plaza de Armas of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  It's known as the folklore capital  because the International Festival of Folklore is held there every January, an event in which the country's roots are highlighted and musical groups from all over South America get together.  There is also the Festival of Traditional Arts and Crafts, attended by artisans from Chile and nearby countries.  Later, in April, there is Abril Cuecas Mil [April, A Thousand Cuecas], an event in which the whole community dances the cueca (a traditional Chilean dance).

loans.use: to buy more children's clothing and vests.

loans.name: Henrry

texts.es: Henry, tiene la edad  de 45 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y dos hijos   actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar semilla de café para hacer un almacigo y los insumos para su mantenimiento. El tiene pensado hacer este almacigo  y con los insumos mantenerlo en buenas condiciones y venderlo en el mercado de la localidad y lugares aledaños y así  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Henry is 45 years old. He is married and at present lives with his wife and two children. With this loan he plans on buying coffee beans to make a seedbed and supplies to take care of it. He thought of making this seedbed and with the supplies keep it in good condition and sell it in the local market and surrounding areas. This way he will generate more earnings and obtain a better quality of life and economic stability.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had any loans with other state banks but FUDECOSUR have given him this loan with better services and lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy coffee beans

loans.name: Concentidas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS CONCENTIDAS está  compuesto por nueve integrantes, siete mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Carolina tiene 40 años y es soltera con un hijo que tiene la edad de nueve años, ella se dedica a la venta de jugos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona Villa Paraíso,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Carolina  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de extractoras y licuadoras para elaborar jugos para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es ampliar su negocio y ofrecer variedad de jugos a su clientes, la Sra. Carolina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son comprarse extractoras  y  licuadoras y va a utilizar los beneficios par seguir equipando su negocio y así poder generar mayores ingresos,  La Sra. Carolina es una persona muy trabajadora sola saca delante a su familia, esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene, se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos como el de ella mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank LAS CONCENTIDAS is formed by nine members; seven women and two men. The president of the bank is Carolina. She is 40 years old and is single with a nine year old son. She makes a living selling juices on her stall which is located in the Villa Paraíso area. 

This loan is her first cycle with this MFI. Carolina will use this loan to buy extractors and blenders to make juices for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is to extend her business and offer more variety of juices to her customers. Carolina faces challenges in her business and needs to buy extractors and blenders. She is going to use the profits to continue equipping her business and so generate more profits. Carolina is a very hard working person who gets her family ahead on her own. This is the only business activity she carries out. 

She feels happy for the opportunity that has been given to her as do the other group members, some of whom also look after their family's on their own.

loans.use: to buy extractors and blenders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten.

loans.name: 71-24 De Septiembre Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 71- 24 De Septiembre, está  compuesto por nueve integrantes todas mujeres la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Balbina,  tiene 40 años y es soltera con tres  hijos que son de las edades de 15, 12  y 8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta  que se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Joronchito  este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Balbina  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como arroz, fideo, carne y huevo para elaboración de sus comidas, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo la Sra. Balbina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la compra de insumos para elaborar sus riquísimos platillos y ofrecer a su clientela  variedad de platillos y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos para su negocio y así poder generar mayores ingresos,  La Sra. Balbina es una persona muy trabajadora sola saca delante a su familia, esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene, se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos como el de ella mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group 71- 24 De Septiembre is comprised of 9 women and the president of the group is Balbina.  Balbina is 40 years old and she is single.  She has three children that are 15, 12, and 8 years old.  She sells food in her shop that is located in Joronchito.  This loan is her fourth loan.  Balbina will use this loan to buy ingredients such as rice, noodles, meat, and eggs so that she can prepare her dishes.  She is seeking this loan because she doesn't have any cash.  

Balbina faces challenges in her business such as being able to buy ingredients so that she can make her delicious dishes and offer a variety of those dishes to her customers.  She uses her income to buy ingredients for her business, and in time she is able to earn more income.

Balbina is a hard-working person and the sole provider for her family (this is the only business that supports her family).  She is happy for the opportunity that is being offered to her and to the others in her group, because many of them are also the sole providers for their families as well.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, noodles, meat, and eggs for making meals.

loans.name: Johana Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Johanna, tiene la edad de 26 años, habita en el municipio de La Concepción junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para una empresa de vigilancia  quien apoya económicamente y con los gastos del hogar, gracias A Dios continua con su cultivos de Piña. Ellos con mucho esfuerzo están construyendo un muro para su vivienda y gracias a este nuevo financiamiento podrán comprar lo necesario  piedras, piedrín, cemento, arena y pagar la mano de obra. Para poder terminar su proyecto.
Agradecen nuevamente a Afodenic la confianza  que tienen al brindarles este nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Johanna is 26 years old and lives in the La Concepción area with her husband who works for a security company and supports the family by paying all of their household expenses.  Thanks to God, they also can continue working on their pineapple crops.

With a lot of work, they are building a wall for their home, and thanks to this new loan, they will be able to buy supplies such as stones, bricks, cement, and sand.  They will also be able to pay for a worker to help them and finish this project.

They send many thanks to Afodenic for having confidence in them and providing them this new loan.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, stones,  and to pay a contractor.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнаре 50 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, с 1992года Гульнара занимается животноводством, стартовав с суммы 20,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодня в хозяйстве Гульнары имеется 4 дойные коровы, 2 лошади и 4 овцы. Ежемесячная прибыль  от продажи молока и молочных продуктов  составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульнара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы Гульнара планирует вложить в обучение своих детей.
texts.en:
Gulnara is 50 years old, married, and has two children. As a source of income for the family, Gulnara has been engaged in livestock breeding since 1992, having started with an amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Currently Gulnara's farm has four milking cows, two horses and four sheep. The monthly income from selling milk and dairy products is 7,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulnara turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock to fatten and resell. Gulnara plans to invest the income in her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 41 год, замужем, имеет 2 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, с 1993года Анаркан занимается животноводством, стартовав с покупки 10 голов овец.  На сегодня в хозяйстве Анаркан имеется 3 дойные коровы, 30 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль  от продажи молока и молочных продуктов  составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы Анаркан планирует вложить в расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Anarkan is 41 years old, married, and has two children. As a source of income for her family, Anarkan started working with livestock breeding in 1993, having started with the purchase of 10 sheep. Currently Anarkan has three milking cows and 30 sheep at her farm. The monthly income from selling milk and dairy products is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Anarkan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of 10 sheep. Anarkan plans to invest the income in expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home (repair the roof)

loans.name: Janarkul

texts.ru: Жанаркул 33 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Жанаркул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1997 года занимается разведением скота. Начав этот бизнес с покупки коровы, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день  хозяйстве Жанаркул имеется 3 коровы  с приплодом, что позволяет ей располагать ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жанаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец.  Доходы от кредита Жанаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства для того, чтобы в будущем иметь возможность дать детям хорошее образование.
texts.en:
Janarkul is 33 years old, married, and raising three children. As a main source of income for her family, Janarkul has been engaged in livestock breeding since 1997. After having started this business with the purchase of a cow, Janarkul, due to her hard work, currently has three cows with offspring at her farm. This allows her a monthly profit of the amount of 5,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Janarkul turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep. Janarkul plans to invest the income from the loan in further growing her farm, in order to be able to give her children a good education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Los Cumplidos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento Los Cumplidos está  compuesto por nueve integrantes seis mujeres y tres varones la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Aurora  tiene 35 años y es soltera con seis  hijos que son de las edades de 14, 12, 11, 9  y 5 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta  que se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Zanja Honda,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Aurora  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como arroz, fideo, aceite y carne  para elaboración de sus comidas, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo la Sra. Aurora enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la compra de insumos para elaborar sus riquísimos platillos y ofrecer a su clientela  variedad de platillos y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos para su negocio y así poder generar mayores ingresos,  La Sra. Aurora es una persona muy trabajadora sola saca delante a su familia, esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene, se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos como el de ella mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group Los Cumplidos is comprised of 9 people (6 women and 3 men).  The president of the group is Aurora.  Aurora is 35 years old and she is single with six children that are 14, 12, 11, 9, and 5 years old.  She sells food in her food stall that is located in Zanja Honda. 

This loan is her first from the institution.  Aurora will use the loan to buy ingredients such as rice, noodles, oil, and meat for making her dishes.  She is seeking the loan because she does not have the money she needs.  In her business it is difficult to buy ingredients to use in her delicious dishes and to offer her customers a variety of dishes.  She will use the loan to continue buying ingredients for her business, and this will enable her to earn a higher income.

Aurora is a very hard-working person and supports her family.  This is the only work that supports her family.  She feels happy for the opportunity given to her and her fellow group members, most of whom are also the sole providers for their families.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, noodles, oil, and meat

loans.name: Burulush

texts.ru: Бурулуш 41 год, вдова, воспитывает 2 собственных детей  и 5 приемных, которых взяла к себе на воспитание после смерти сестры. Бурулуш в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1998 года занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с покупки 2 коров, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день  хозяйстве Бурулуш имеется 5 коров, 10 овец и 1 лошадь. Также Бурулуш возделывает 1,0 га орошаемой земли, где она выращивает клевер. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет сумму 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулуш обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец с целью откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Бурулуш планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса за счет продуктового магазина, чтобы в будущем иметь возможность дать детям хорошее образование.
texts.en:
Burulush is 41 years old, a widow, and raising two children by herself, as well as five foster children, which she took in after her sister died. As a main source of income for her family, Burulush has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 1998. After having started this business with the purchase of two cows, Burulush, due to her hard work, currently has five cows, ten sheep and one horse at her farm. Further, Burulush cultivates 1.0 hectares of land, where she grows clover (for fodder). The monthly income from the farm is in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Burulush turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 45,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep with the goal to fatten and resell them. Burulush plans to invest the income from the loan in further growing her business through a grocery store, in order to have the possibility to give the children a good education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Maludajan

texts.ru: Малудажан 52 года, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. Малудажан работает в комиссариате  и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в начале 2012 года начала  заниматься разведением скота. Начав этот бизнес с покупки 1 коровы, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день  Малудажан имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы  и 4 овцы, что приносит прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом. Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Малудажан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 105,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку породистых овец с целью откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Малудажан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Maludajan is 52 years old, married and has raised four children. Maludajan works at a commissariat and as an additional source of income for her family, she started working with livestock breeding in the beginning of 2012. After having started this business with the purchase of one cow, Maludajan, due to her hard work, currently has two cows and four sheep at her farm, which gives her an income of the amount of 5,000 som (KGS).

Having concluded that this business is profitable, Maludajan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 105,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of purebred sheep with a goal to fatten and resell them. Maludajan plans to invest the income from the loan in further growing her farm.

loans.use: to purchase purebred sheep

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Raquel de 36 años de edad es originaria de un pueblo llamado Santa Catarina Mechocan. Doña Raquel se dedica a la venta ropa desde hace cuatro años y calzado desde hace cinco. Una de las cosas que más le gustan de su negocio es atender a sus clientes y sobre todo tener los pedidos de sus clientes a tiempo. Ella que vende su mercancía en su casa y sus hijos Luz Violeta, Juan Gerardo y Rosa Cristina le ayudan atendiendo a los clientes cuando doña ella está ocupada, haciendo los quehaceres de la casa. Una de las experiencias que ha tenido Doña Raquel en su negocio es que si atiende bien a las personas, ellos la recomiendan y así puede generar más clientes y ganancias.

Al hablar del inicio de su negocio, Raquel comenta que primero empezó a vender calzado por catálogo y con sus ganancias y la ayuda de su esposo Gerardo, pudo comprar ropa y así iniciar el otro negocio. Raquel se considera una persona especial porque siempre trata de ser la mejor madre, esposa y sobre todo jefa de su propio negocio, ya que todo lo que  hace es por el bienestar de sus hijos ya que ellos son el motor que la impulsa para seguir hasta el final sin rendirse.

Raquel pidió el crédito para la compra de más calzado y ropa para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo. Le da las gracias a Vision Fund por ayudarla para que pueda seguir con su negocio y con sus ganancias darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Raquel is 36 years old and is originally from a town called Santa Catarina Mechocan.  Raquel has sold clothing for the past 4 years and footwear for the past 5 years.  One of the things she likes most in her business is to provide good service for her customers and to have all of her customer's orders on time.  She sells her merchandise from her home and her children Luz Violeta, Juan Gerardo, and Rosa Cristine help her with her customers when she is busy by taking care of the house.  One of the biggest learning experiences that Raquel had is that if she provided good service to her customers, they recommended her and this helped her generate more customers.

In speaking about the beginning of her business, Raquel comments that she first began to sell footwear by catalog and with her income and the help of her husband Gerardo, she was able to purchase clothing and begin a second business.  Raquel is considered a special person because she always tries to be a better mother, wife, and manager of her business.  Everything she does is for the benefit of her children, and they are the engine that drives her to continue on and never give up.

Raquel asked for a loan so that she can buy more footwear and clothing for sale via wholesale and retail.  She gives thanks to the Vision Fund for helping her be able to continue running her business, and with her income she will provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes to sell wholesale and retail.

loans.name: Bonanza Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento BONANZA está  compuesto por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Rosario en la foto es la que esta vestida con una blusa café  y un pantalón blanco ; esta de cabello  semi recogido de color castaño claro y esta parada casi a  lado de la secretaria  que esta vestida con una polera azul, la Sra. Rosario tiene 41 años y es soltera con dos hijos de 19 y 23 años, ella se dedica a la venta de dulce, galletas y refrescos en su  kiosco de venta que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de la colorada  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosario   va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería, galletas refrescos y dulce por mayor  para surtir su  negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo la Sra. Rosario enfrenta retos en su negocio que son comprarse variedad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería para su negocio y así poder generar mayores ingresos,  La Sra. Rosario es una persona muy trabajadora sola saca delante a su familia, esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene, se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos como el de ella mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank BONANZA consists of eight members; seven women and one man. The president of the bank is Rosario. In the photo she is wearing a coffee coloured blouse and white trousers. She has light brown hair which is partly tied back and is standing almost next to the secretary who is wearing a blue T-shirt. Rosario is 41 years old, and is single with two children aged 19 and 23. She makes a living selling sweets, biscuits and drinks in her kiosk stall which is located in the area of Colorada.

This loan will be her first cycle with this MFI. Rosario is going to use this loan to buy stock; biscuits, drinks and sweets wholesale, to stock her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is lack of capital. Rosario faces difficulties in her business to buy a variety of products to offer to her customers and is going to use the profits to continue buying stock for her business and so generate more income.

Rosario is a very hard working person who gets her family ahead on her own. This is the only business activity that she carries out. She feels happy for the opportunity given to her, as do the other group members, some of whom also look after their families on their own.

loans.use: to buy stock such as sweets, biscuits and drinks.

loans.name: Afepeb 2 Group

texts.fr: AFEPEB 2 est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Blandine Léonie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 60 ans et est une veuve. Blandine Léonie est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à sa charge.  Blandine Léonie a très peu fréquenté l’école. Blandine Léonie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et assure seule ses divers besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Depuis près de seize ans, Blandine Léonie vend des tissus et des produits vivriers par le système de distribution et dans un marché du Bénin. Blandine Léonie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin.  C’est la troisième fois que Blandine Léonie et le second membre du groupe AFEPEB 2 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
AFEPEB 2 is a group of two people who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Blandine Léonie (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and is a 60-year-old widow. She is a mother of four children, some of whom are at school. Two of her children remain under her care. 

Blandine Léonie lives with her children, and is solely responsible for ensuring that her various needs and those of her children are met. For almost 16 years she has sold fabrics and staple foods through the distribution system and in a market located in Benin. Blandine Léonie gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

This is the third time that Blandine Léonie and the second member of the AFEPEB 2 group have requested financial support from ALIDé. They have done so to increase their working capital and better meet the needs of their customers. The loans they received in the past have been successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and staple foods.

loans.name: Ireti Group

texts.fr: IRETI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Kpokpogbé Madeleine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à un certain Germain. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Kpokpogbé Madeleine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de douze ans, Kpokpogbé Madeleine vend des chaussures dans un marché du Benin. Kpokpogbé Madeleine s’approvisionne au Togo. C’est la deuxième fois que Kpokpogbé Madeleine et les autres membres du groupe IRETI sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
IRETI is a group of three people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Kpokpogbé Madeleine (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), who is 51 years of age and married to Germain. The couple has three children, some at school and all under their care. 

Kpokpogbé Madeleine lives with her children and husband, and together with her husband is responsible for the various household expenses. For almost 12 years she has sold shoes in a market in Benin. She gets her supplies from Togo.

This is the second time that Kpokpogbé Madeleine and the other members of the group have requested the financial support of ALIDé. They have done so to increase their working capital and strengthen their business, and to better respond to their customers’ needs. The first loan they received was successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Massavo Group

texts.fr: MASSAVO est un groupement de vingt et un personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier et sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Yènidji Orguette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un boulanger du nom de Jérémie. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Yènidji Orguette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Yènidji Orguette vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de trois ans, Yènidji Orguette vend par le système de distribution, de la farine de blé et des tissus. Yènidji Orguette s’approvisionne au Nigeria. C’est la première fois que Yènidji Orguette et les autres membres du groupement MASSAVO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
MASSAVO is a group of 21 people, who are all friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Yènidji Orguette (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is 29 years of age and married to a baker called Jérémie. The couple has a child in school, who is under their care. 

Yènidji Orguette did not go to school. She lives together with her child and her husband. Together the couple covers the various household expenses. For almost three years Yènidji Orguette has sold wheat flour and fabrics through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Nigeria. 

This is the first time that Yènidji Orguette and the other members of the MASSAVO group have requested the financial support of ALIDé. They have done so to increase their working capital and strengthen their business, as well as to better meet their customers’ needs.

loans.use: To buy fabric and wheat flour.

loans.name: Yessel Juanita

texts.es:
Yessel es una joven de 26 años de edad, la cual es muy entusiasta y trabajadora, es madre de un pequeño de 5 años, quien es su adoración y su motivo para seguir adelante cada día a pesar de las adversidades. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso, asimismo encontramos a las líneas de Nazca, las cuales reciben a muchos turistas que las visitan en todo el año, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, pallares, tuna, entre otros, también se le conoce por la generosidad y amabilidad de sus pobladores.

Día a día Yessel trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes el cual logro tener con mucho ahorro y sobre todo esfuerzo ya que gracias a ello ella pude solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos.

Yessel esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como bebidas gaseosas, cerveza, golosinas, detergente, productos de para limpieza del hogar, entre otros, así de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y tendrá mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijo y tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Yessel is a young 26 year old who is enthusiastic and hard working. She is mother to a little five year old, who she adores and is her reason for continuing every day despite her problems. She lives in Nazca, a city noted for its hot climate and for having the Nazca Lines which attract many tourists throughout the year, as well as developing farming especially cotton, lima beans, prickly pear, among others. Its inhabitants are known for their generosity and friendliness.

Yessel works every day in her grocery store business which she managed to have thanks to her savings and above all her hard work. Thanks to this she can pay all her household bills. She works in her store around 12 hours per day and can serve up to 15 customers during the day. She believes that her business is going well because she is friendly to her customers and above all because she offer good quality products at affordable prices.

Yessel is very grateful to Kiva as thanks to the help she has been given she will be able to buy stock for her business such as soda drinks, beer, sweets, detergents, household cleaning products and other items. In this way she will be able to improve her income and she will have more products to offer to her customers, which will allow her to continue working and fighting to fulfil her biggest dream: "To give her son a good education and to have her own house."

loans.use: to buy stock (soda drinks, beer, sweets, detergents, household cleaning products, among other items).

loans.name: El Centro De Telixtac Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama El Centro de Telixtac, está conformado por la señora Victorina va a comprar con su préstamo pollo vivo, las señoras Araceli, Evelia, Socorro y Olga van a comprar maíz y leña. Las integrantes del grupo quiren decirle a Kiva y a Vision Fund "les agradecemos sus prestamos nos ayudan a crecer los negocios y que nos sigan ayudando con sus prestamos" La señora Olga tiene 47 años de edad, ella es casada, ella no tiene hijos, ella vende dulces, tortillas hechas a mano, bolis y leña. Ella solicito su préstamo para comprar dulces, paletas, chicles, azúcar, chicharrones, aceite, maíz, leña. Ella inicio su negocio hace un año era de su mama y se lo dejo porque tuvo que salir de su comunidad, su negocio es importante porque tiene ganancias que utiliza para la comida y para vestir, a ella le gusta atender a sus clientes que son los niñoS amablemente para que regresen a comprar, sus sueños y esperanzas que su negocio crezca.
texts.en: This communal bank is called El Centro de Telixtac. One of its members is Victorina. With her loan, she is going to buy live chickens. Araceli, Evelia, Socorro and Olga are going to buy corn and firewood. The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Vision Fund "we thank you for your loans. They help us grow our businesses and we hope you keep helping us with your loans." Olga is 47 years old. She is married and has no children. She sells candies, handmade tortillas, popsicles and firewood. She asked for her loan to buy candies, popsicles, gum, sugar, chicharrones, oil, corn and firewood. She started her business  year ago. It was her mother's and she left it to her when she had to leave the community. Her business is important because it has earnings that she she uses to buy food and clothing. She likes to serve her customers, who are children, in a friendly way so that they come back to buy from her. Her hopes and dreams are for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy candies, popsicles, gum, chicharrones, oil, corn, firewood

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Bancomunal Fortaleza, tiene 40 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años. Ella es dueña de una tienda donde vende productos Agro-Químicos. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Le gusta ser parte de Bancomunal ya que gracias a las capacitaciones que allí recibe aprendió a ahorrar y a realizar buenas inversiones en su negocio. Su meta es poder construir su casa propia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos agro-químicos (fertilizantes, abonos).
texts.en: Julia is a member of the Fortaleza communal bank. She is 40 years old and the mother of 2 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 3 years. She is the owner of a store where she sells agro-chemical products. She is grateful to the institution for the ease of the loans that they offer. She likes being a part of the communal bank since thanks to the trainings she gets there she learned to make good investments in her business. Her goal is to be able to build her own house. She is asking for the loan to invest in buying agro-chemical products (fertilizers)

loans.use: to buy agro-chemical products (fertilizers)

loans.name: Srey Touch

texts.en:
Srey Touch (pictured here) is a garment worker while her husband, Chet, is a mechanic. They have been married since 1991 and have two sons who are both mechanics. The family lives in a village just outside of Phnom Penh City.

One of Srey Touch’s sons would like to stop working as mechanic in order to become a driver. He has a great opportunity to work as a driver for a company or factory after he completes his driving classes and receives his driving license.

Therefore, Srey Touch would like to request her second loan in the amount of $500 to help her son to pay for his driving school fees.

loans.use: to pay for driving school fees for her son.

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Chin is aged 46 years and a married mother of two children; one daughter and one son who are dependent and still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland for more than ten years while her husband catches fish to generate additional income. The main challenges for her business is the flooding affecting her rice and insects. 

Chin’s group consists of two members who are female and they have been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. The loans have helped her make a good living and to be able to afford to keep her children in school. Now she is able to earn around 30,000KHR per day. She is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and fish netting for her business. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fish netting for her business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es socia del Bancomunal Fortaleza, es casada y madre de 7 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 10 años. Se dedica a la venta de flores frente al cementerio general y también tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa que atiende con la ayuda de sus hijas en sus tiempos libres. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ha ofrecido durante todos estos años que tiene como socia. Le gusta mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que aprende nuevos temas que la ayudan a progresar en su negocio y como madre. Su meta es brindar educación superior a 2 de sus hijos que ahora son estudiantes. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá  en sus dos negocios tanto para la compra de flores como para la compra de abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en: Isabel is a member of the Fortaleza communal bank. She is married and the mother of 7 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 10 years. She sells flowers in front of the general cementary and aslo has a small grocery store in her house that she runs with the help of her daughters in their free time. She is grateful to the institution for the ease of the loans that they have offered her all these years that she has been a member. She really likes the trainings that she gets in her communal bank since she learns about new topics that help her progress in her business and as a mother. Her goal is to offer a higher education to her two children who are in school right now. The loan that she is asking for will be invested in buying flowers and also to buy groceries for her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store such as rice, sugar, oil, pasta, milk, etc.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 38-years-old and is a married woman with 4 children aged between 1 and 19 years. She has been involved in seaweed farming for 7 years. Emily works hard to provide for the needs of her family, especially proper education to her children. 

She requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs. She hopes for her income to increase and which will enable her to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs.

loans.name: German

texts.es: German de 63 años vive en el Corregimiento de Campeche, con su familia conformada por su esposa y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 26 a 36 años de edad. Él genera el ingreso de su familia trabajando en su propio negocio, mediante el cual vende carne a tiendas, establecimientos y familias del corregimiento, que compra en el municipio de Baranoa en el Departamento de Atlántico. Este negocio es parte de la tradición de su  padre y German continuó con el, una vez falleció su progenitor. Con su negocio ha obtenido grandes logros, como el adquirir su propia casa y generar siempre, los ingresos familiares. Germán también vende helados y tiene un congelador para ello, que le genera ingresos adicionales. Ahora sueña mas adelante, es fomentar a través de él negocio,  empleo entre jóvenes, organizándolo bien y ampliando su cobertura. Pero esto se convierte en su gran desafío, porque no tiene el capital de trabajo suficiente, para alcanzar sus propósitos; esta es la razón por la que acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  carne en mayor volumen pues su demanda ha crecido y se hace necesario responderle para logar necesidades satisfechas, tanto para su clientela, como para si mismo, porque con el incremento se verá favorecido Germán , con el aumento sus ingresos y esto es lo que realmente hace que un credikiva tenga mucho éxito.
texts.en:
German is 63 years old and lives in Corregimiento de Campeche with his family, which consists of his wife and three children who are between the ages of 26 and 36. He generates income for his family by working in his own business. German sells meat to stores, establishments, and families within his subdivision. He purchases his products in the town of Baranoa in the Department of Atlántico. This business is part of the tradition started by his father and German decided to continue it when he died. He has been able to accomplish great things with his business, like acquiring a house of his own and generating a steady stream of income for his family.

German also sells ice cream and has a freezer for conducting this activity as a means of earning additional income. Now he dreams of moving forward since he is encouraged by his business. He plans to hire young people, organize his business well, and expand the coverage of his sales territory. Accomplishing these goals will be a great challenge because he does not have sufficient operating capital. For this reason, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. German will use the money to buy meat in bulk since demand has increased and he needs to respond to his customers. He sees this increase as favorable because it translates into more income. This is the outcome that will make his Kiva loan a great success.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Ek Phnom district, Chantha is a 32-year-old widow with only one son who works at the family’s business. She has earned a living through farming rice, planting beans and watermelon as the main source of the family’s income for several years. Sometimes Chantha and her son catch fish for sale to generate additional income for the family. With her business, she has been facing floods and unhealthy crops, which are her main challenges. 

Chantha is in her fifth loan cycle while her other group member is in her second loan cycle with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her make a good living. Now she is able to earn a daily income of around 19,000 KHR. She is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Savun's Group

texts.en:
As a widower, Savun has been planting cassava to support his family for almost ten years. He is 60 years old and has eight children, three of whom are staying with the family and work at the field and as paid workers.

Savun has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and is now requesting another loan after completely repaying the previous debts. As a leader, Savun will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his cassava plantation and really hopes that he will get better crop yields and generate more income as a result.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin, age 55, is a rice farmer. Her husband, Ly, age 61, raises cows and male cows used for breeding. They live in a village along the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City, and they have nine children: eight sons and one daughter. One is married, another one is a garment worker, another one is a construction worker and another is a house constructor, while another one drives a horse cart and the other four attend school.  

Yin is in the process of renovating her new house to live in (in the photo). She still needs money to finish some parts of her house. That’s why Yin decided to apply for a loan in the amount of $500.

loans.use: to finish her house renovations

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary is a 50-year-old widow of six children, only one of whom is still in school. To make a living as a widow, she has been farming rice as her main source of the family’s income. In addition, she has two cows to support her rice farming business. The main challenge for her is the floods which affected her rice production. 

Sary has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles already and successfully repaid the loans while her group members have been with VisionFund for one to four cycles. With her current business, she manages to earn around 48,000 KHR per day to spend on daily expenses. Now requesting a loan with her group members, Sary, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more rice and increase her family’s income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a María, tiene 28 años de edad, está soltera y aun  vive en casa de sus padres. Ella es Lic. en Ciencias De La Educación pero no ejerce su profesión. 

Nuestra amiga es una joven muy emprendedora que a pesar de tener un título universitario no se quedo esperando que el trabajo le llegue sino que emprendió su propio negocio, ella tiene un restaurante frente a la playa de Crucita, allí trabaja todos los días junto con tres personas más a quienes  les paga por su trabajo, nos cuenta que a diario llegan muchas personas a servirse sus deliciosos platos y comenta que los mas pedidos son los mariscos, ella lleva 7 años con este negocio el cual le ha a ayudado mucho.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, mariscos y otros víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace un año y le gusta  la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener propio local pues el que tiene es arrendado.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank "Crucita" meet in the parish of Crucita in the canton of Portoviejo. This location is known for its beautiful surrounding beaches that are frequented by domestic and foreign tourists. It is also known by its nickname "Crucita la Bella" (Crucita the Beautiful).

It is in this place that one can meet María. She is 28 years old, single, and lives at her parents' house. María is a licensed teacher, but she does not work in that profession.

She is a very enterprising young woman. Even though she has a college degree, María could not wait to get a job, so she decided to start her own business. She has a restaurant in front of the beach in Crucita. There she works with three employees who are paid for their time. She says that many people come to her establishment every day to be served delicious dishes. María reveals that shellfish is the dish that is most requested. She has been in this business for seven years and it has been a great help.

This loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil, shellfish, and other necessary ingredients for preparing her dishes. María has been with her Communal Bank for one year and enjoys the help that the loans have given her. Her dream is to have her own location since she is currently renting the one she has now.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, shellfish, and other ingredients.
